results.description:
Hearing the Web: Incorporating Accessibility User Testing into the UX Process
Bruce Howell
Accessibility Services Coordinator, The Carroll Center for the Blind


Bruce will speak about the benefits of building accessible web content so that consumers of all abilities can access and interact with it. He will provide a brief overview of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0) and how they address inclusion under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) to ensure that all consumers have equal access to the online content you design, build or test for your employer or clients. 


Bruce will share why input from consumers with disabilities should be incorporated into your User Experience testing process. He will explain how the Carroll Center is uniquely positioned to assist companies and organizations when your testing plan includes blind or visually impaired consumers. 


Finally, he will provide a live demonstration of how using JAWS, a screen reading software, allows him to interact in a nonvisual way with web content. You will see for yourself the difference between web content that is coded well versus content that was not designed with accessibility in mind. Whether you’ve ever seen or heard a screen reader in action, it is always an interesting experience that can challenge your perceptions! 

Agenda
6:30 - 7:00 PM – Networking and Refreshments
7:00 - 7:15 PM – Introductions
7:15 - 8:00 PM - Presentation
8:00 - 8:15 PM - Q&A 

About Bruce Howell

Bruce, a graduate of Colgate University in Hamilton, NY, enjoyed a long career in Retail Banking for a Boston area community bank. Then in 2011 & 2012, he worked as the Employer Account Manager for the Greater Boston Employment Collaborative. In this role, Bruce pursued business development to facilitate access to job postings and led a group of 38 Job Developers representing several Boston area human service agencies serving disabled job seekers.
In his current role with the Carroll Center, Bruce has primary responsibility for business development and project management. He coordinates the internal work flow on accessibility projects from start to finish. This begins by assisting clients to identify and articulate their accessibility needs, and moves to matching Carroll Center personnel and resources in order to best meet those client requirements. Bruce communicates with clients throughout the evaluation or testing process and facilitates interaction between the Accessibility Services team and the client. He is a proficient user of some of the Assistive Technologies which the Accessibility Services team uses to conduct testing and evaluation of websites and other online content.
In his spare time Bruce is a competitive sailor with the SailBlind program out of the Courageous Sailing Center in Charlestown. He is the Chair of the Massachusetts Commission for the Blind’s Rehabilitation Advisory Council, and is also an appointed member of Needham’s Commission on Disabilities. 

About The Carroll Center for the Blind


Each year The Carroll Center for the Blind helps 5,000 blind or visually impaired children, adults and senior citizens to achieve greater independence and fulfillment in their lives. The Carroll Center serves the needs of these blind and visually impaired persons by providing rehabilitation, skills training, and educational opportunities to help them achieve independence, self-sufficiency, and self-fulfillment. The Carroll Center also advocates on their behalf by educating the public regarding the potential of persons who are blind and visually impaired. We have pioneered many innovative services for the blind and visually impaired, and have developed many methods for people with no or low vision to learn the skills to be independent in their homes, in class settings, and in their work places. You can learn more about the Carroll Center at <a>www.carroll.org.</a> 

Can't Attend?
Please login into Eventbrite to cancel your RSVP. 

Code of Conduct
By registering and attending any UXPA Boston event, you agree to follow our Code of Conduct. If you have any questions, please contact a Board Member.

results.description:
This monthly Meetup is a place to learn tunes and to play them slowly with other musicians. The tunes we play can be found here (Sheet Music). Since the list is getting large we have started selecting a rotating list of about ten tunes a month that we will definitely play so that new members can have a chance to play along without learning every tune right away. I update this list and email it monthly.

This is still a new group, and how we go about learning and playing is still a work in progress. But the goal is to have fun, and to get together with others who enjoy playing Irish music. Musicians of all levels are welcome. Since the goal here is for everyone to play, new members are encouraged to suggest tunes from the list and to suggest tunes to add to it. If the group as a whole knows a tune well, we'll play it slowly a couple of times, and then pick the tempo up a bit. 

Note on tempo

If you have gone to a typical Irish Session, we play a little faster than half that speed. But we'll start tunes slowly enough that everyone should be able to play along and learn by ear. If you haven't been to a session it is best to just show up and see if the tempo suits you :)  If you like metronomes...  For Reels (4/4), Hornpipes (4/4) and Polkas (2/4) set the metronome from 100 to 140 BPM and play one quarter note per click. For Double Jigs (6/8), Slip Jigs (9/8), and Single Jigs (12/8) set the metronome from 65 to 95 BPM and play three eighth notes per click. 

Directions

By Subway

The closest Red Line stop is Davis Square. From Davis Square you can either walk Northwest on Holland Street or take the bus (the 87 or the 88) to Teele Square. It is about a 10 minute walk between Davis and Teele Square. You can recognize Teele Square as a 5-way intersection with a small triangular island having a sign that says Teele Square. From Teele Square walk North on Curtiss Street for 3 blocks to Powder House Boulevard. The church is on the NE corner of the intersection.

By Bus

The 87, 88, and 89 buses stop in Teele Square.  The 87 bus runs between Lechmere Station (Green Line) and Arlington Center. The 88 bus runs between Lechmere Station (Green Line) and the Clarendon Hill Busway. The 89 bus runs between Sullivan Square (Orange Line) and the Clarendon Hill Busway. You'll want to get off the bus in Teele Square. From Teele Square walk North on Curtiss Street for 3 blocks to Powder House Boulevard. The church is on the NE corner of the intersection. The 77 bus runs between Harvard and Arlington Heights. You can walk from Mass Ave to Teele Square.

By Car

There is parking behind the West Somerville School that is one block West of the church. Parking there is available after 5PM even though the signs are somewhat ambiguous. From Powderhouse, turn onto Curtis, heading up the hill toward Tufts. Take the first left turn from Curtis onto Raymond Street. Ignore the NO LEFT TURN sign, as it is only in effect during rush hours. Raymond runs behind the school. The lot is about half a block down Raymond on the left.

Street parking is also available one block away on Packard Avenue from Powderhouse Blvd on the hill to the Tufts University campus. Pay attention to street signs to avoid parking in a restricted area.

See the map at: http://clarendonhillchurch.org/...

Accessibility

The church has a lift that requires someone to move from a wheelchair to the chair on the lift. I haven't had time to look at this yet, but I will have someone show it to me over the holidays.

results.description:
Deepening into the practice of Speaking Circle turns will support you in continuing  to develop full presence in front of groups.  Being in Relational Presence with your audience is the key.

Relational Presence, the foundation of Speaking Circles, is a precondition for all masterful communication. When this state becomes your default mode of approaching every communication, you effortlessly step into a natural flow. 

Developing your capacity for Relational Presence is like strengthening a muscle that has been neglected. Unlike the struggle that physical workouts are for many, this exercise is designed to be highly pleasurable. There may be some initial confusion, discomfort, self-doubt but hang in there and do the reps no matter how it feels or what you are thinking.  With practice you will find . . . 

* Speaking Circles support you to access your natural public presence, along with your capacity to unselfconsciously express passion and purpose.

* Reach hearts, minds and souls every time through the practice of being in a Speaking Circle.

* Transmit your message and content with ease to groups of any size by practicing attunement with one listener at a time.

* Give up conventional notions of "public speaking" and discover the magic of authentic intimacy with audiences.
results.name: Deepening into Speaking From Presence

results.description:
Do you have a dream? Does your dream have a plan? 
Dreams without a plan can become unfulfilled fantasies. But with a Dream Creation Plan they can powerfully become your reality. Fulfilling your dreams is a learnable process. Join us this evening for inspiration and insight to learn how to fulfill and live your dreams.

Our Topic This Evening...

will inspire you to take actions that will enable you to live your dreams.

During our evening, you will have an opportunity to design your own Dream Creation Plan.  You will:

• clarify your Dreams (purpose and vision)

• create an action plan


• disarm your private saboteur

• and generate a community of support

To Prepare for the evening, consider these questions:

1)  What dreams have you fulfilled? 
2) What dreams do you want to fulfill? 
3) What are your biggest roadblock?

Our Leader This Evening is Nancy Cantor

Nancy Cantor has been a lifestyle/business coach for over 20 years.  Previously, a special education teacher, a new-age jewelry designer, and manager and course leader, she now offers community-based personal growth curriculums to women solo-entrepreneurs through her Dream Factory Communities and to small business owners in MetroWest through The Entrepreneurs Connection. 

Through Cantor Consulting, she offers private coaching to business owners and leadership development programs for their employees.

Her approach is a fusion of personal growth and professional success.

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies:

results.description:
This is a 4 week course. If you RSVP for this date you are RSVPing for the complete 4 week course. Please only RSVP if you are committed to attending to the whole series.


This course introduces students to the basic principles of 3D modeling, such as how to navigate in 3D space, what 3D models are made out of, and how to create simple forms and objects. The software used will be Sketchup, a free program that is excellent for beginners and professionals alike. Students will learn the ins and outs of the program, from basic techniques to advanced modeling concepts. This series is for people who have not already taken a 3D modeling class at HATCH.


Requirements:


• A free copy of Sketchup. 

• A CAD-capable laptop or desktop. The computer must have a discrete graphics chip or a very new (last three years) onboard graphics chip.


• A three button (minimum) mouse.


• You must be an experienced Windows or Mac user.


• You should be able to utilize keyboard shortcuts and understand how to use computer file systems.


*If you need a laptop please contact the organizer, we have six laptops available for use. We prefer that you use your own for this class.*

If you are bringing your own computer, please pre-load Sketchup Make. You can download it from www.sketchup.com.
results.how_to_find_us: We're located in the Arsenal Project (formerly Arsenal Mall). Park in the lot near Old Navy entrance, you'll see a big yellow-green sign over the doors. HATCH is between Pearle Vision and Game Stop.
results.name: Introduction to 3D Modeling (4 week class)

results.description:
ALEWIFE PANERA. $20 to attend. Please be on time and sign up only if you're positive you can be present.


In this workshop we'll read your work and give you constructive suggestions to strengthen it. From larger structural and character considerations to minor formatting and story bumps, we'll help you make your script tighter, evocative, and more compelling. 


Please bring at least four copies of ONE of the following:

1. Ten pages of an original feature screenplay (or a ten or less-page short film) that you wrote yourself.
2. A treatment that you wrote yourself (one to two-page synopsis of the plot) for a proposed original screenplay. Please keep treatments to two pages maximum.


If you haven't written a script or treatment, then come with your questions and a willingness to provide constructive feedback for others.


Regardless of what you bring, be sure to PRINT OUT COPIES so that we can read it together. If you don't print them out, we'll have no way to workshop your work! At least four would be appreciated.

If you haven't written a screenplay or treatment but are curious about the process, then we definitely have a place for you. For beginners, we highly recommend grabbing a copy of The Complete Screenwriter's Manual (http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Screenwriters-Manual-Comprehensive-Reference/dp/0321397932) and screenwriting software (free: CeltX.com, more features: FinalDraft.com)

For more personalized script attention, I offer one-on-one screenplay coverage services. Details and testimonials: http://www.screenplay.guru. 10% off for Cambridge Screenwriting members.

We can't wait to see you!

This is a program for those interested in accessing and maintaining higher consciousness. Much of the evening is in silence as you receive 3 crown chakra activations to lift and expand your energy field, bringing you to a felt sense of union with the divine Source energy. Expect to feel profound peace, openness, expansion, and love.  As all Lightbearers are invited and needed to extend and help hold higher vibrations for others on the planet, part of this class will include using meditation, intention and imagery to spread the vibrations we receive.

Sacred high vibrational music plays for the entire evening.  Expect to maintain higher consciousness, giving you a sense of non-dual awareness....being with what is...total acceptance of everything within you and outside of you.

We are all in our awakening process...becoming awake to the Presence within us and living, speaking, loving and creating from that place. To access and maintain that truth of who we really are requires us to let go of any limiting beliefs, habits, memories. Then we can more fully embrace and embody the higher consciousness of our true Self.

Judy guides this class based on her ongoing deep studies and experiences with conscious awakening.  The sweet, profound results of expansion in consciousness occurs in moments. At these meetings we can freely express and connect with like-hearted souls as we share in these powerful energy transmissions. All are welcome to join us and share your own experience of conscious awakening...your challenges, inspirations, intentions and joys. If being in sacred energy appeals to you, you will love this gathering..


"So much peace, it's amazing."

results.description:
Events for the Public

The Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics sponsors a variety of free programs for the public. Among these events are Observatory Nights held on the third Thursday of the month (excluding June, July and August). Observatory Nights feature a nontechnical lecture and telescopic observing from the observatory roof if weather permits. The lectures are intended for high-school age and older audiences but children are also welcome. We also sponsor a variety of other special astronomical events throughout the year. No reservations are necessary, but seating is limited to the auditorium's capacity. Admission is free.

These events--unless otherwise noted--are held in Phillips Auditorium (at the rear of the CfA complex near Madison Street and large parking lot), 60 Garden Street, Cambridge, about 1 mile west of Harvard Square. Parking lots marked for Observatory Staff are open to the public on event nights. Parking is free.

The Observatory does not host private events.

Monthly Observatory Night
Thursday, March 17, 2016
7:30 pm: Where Do Planets Come From?


Anjali Tripathi, CfA


Understanding the birthplaces of planets is an ongoing mystery. Planets have been predicted to form from disks of gas and dust around young stars. New observations of these protoplanetary disks offer exciting evidence for planet formation in action.

For more information, including accessibility, or to sign up for the events mailing list, call the Public Affairs Office, (617)[masked] or email [masked]. Please request sign-language interpretation at least 2 weeks before the event. Current sky information is available.

Entrance is at the west of the CfA complex, near Madison Street and large parking lot. The CfA is easily reached by public transportation. From the Harvard MBTA Station (Red Line), take any bus or trackless trolley going west on Concord Avenue (Arlmont Village and Belmont Center buses, Huron Avenue trolleys) and get off at "Observatory Hill."

Source(s): http://www.cfa.harvard.edu/publicevents

Also available via their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/ObsNights
results.name: Where Do Planets Come From? - Monthly Observatory Night

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

results.description:
Please register for Apex&Geode Integration; Ingestion: Kafka to Hadoop/Apex & Geode on Mar 17,[masked]:00 PM EST at: 

https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/register/2693001217463037700

9:00pm - Webinar will start count down

9:15pm - Apache Geode, and Pivotal's leadership role in open sourcing Geode by Nitin Lamba

9:45pm - Q&A

9:55pm - Details of integration of Apache Apex with Apache Geode by Ashish Tadose

10:35: Q&A

10:45pm - A demo of a big data AdTech pipeline that shows ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop using Apex. Compute and transformations using Apex and finally a load (egress) int Geode by Vitthal Gogate 

11:20pm - Q&A

Sponsored by Ampool

Talk #1: Title - Apex & Geode In-memory computation, storage & analysis 

Abstract: Apache Apex & Apache Geode are two very promising incubating open source projects, combined they promise to fill gaps of existing big data analytics platforms.

Apache Geode provides a database-like consistency model, reliable transaction processing and a shared-nothing architecture to maintain very low latency performance with high concurrency processing. 

In this session we will talk about use cases and on-going efforts of integrating Apex and Geode to build scallable & fault tolerant RealTime streaming applications that ingest from various sources and egress to Geode.

Use case 1 - Geode as data store to write streaming processed data computed by Apex which is powering user applications or dashboards. 

Use case 2 - Apex application reading data from Geode cache and use it for data processing.

Use case 3 - Apex platform's operator checkpointing in Geode to improve performance of Apex batch operations.

Bio: Ashish Tadose is a technical lead at  Ampool, and worked at PubMatic, as a Lead Engineer, Big Data & Analytics, where he led a team driving large scale data ingestion and real-time streaming analytics solutions. Ashish is experienced in design & implementation of scalable streaming analytics technologies such as Apache Storm, Kafka, Kinesis, Flink, Spark Streaming & Apex. Ashish also delivered data infrastructure to facilitate large scale data ingestion from 6 geographic regions in both AWS cloud and in-prem using Kafka and Apex. Prior to PubMatic, Ashish worked at Verisign as Senior Software Engineer in Big Data Team where he worked on projects which required large scale data processing using Hadoop and MapReduce. Ashish holds Bachelors and Masters degree in Computer Science and passionate about development of products leveraging distributed computing platforms. 

Talk #2: Title - Pivotal's effort on Apache Geode by Nitin Lamba

Abstract: Nitin will discuss rationale behind Apache Geode and walk through the leadership role played by Pivotal in OSS efforts of Apache Geode.

Bio: Nitin Lamba is co-founder and head of products at Ampool. He is a veteran in big data and distributed computing

Talks #3: Title – AdTech Pipeline: Kafka->Apex->Geode

Abstract: Demonstration of a common big data AdTech data pipeline using Kafka, Apex, and Geode. The data source is Kafka, and Geode is used to store results of computations. Data will be ingested into Hadoop using Kafka input connector from Apache Malhar. Computations and transformations will then be performed on this data by an Apache Apex application that runs natively in Hadoop. The results are then loaded (egressed) into Geode for UI queries.

Bio: Vitthal Gogate is a Hadoop veteran who has worked on various Hadoop components. His work experience includes Senior Research staff engineer at IBM; Solutions Architect role in Yahoo! Hadoop; Chief Architect and Product Manager of Pivotal Hadoop Distribution; Architect for Hadoop Installation, Management & Monitoring product at Hortonworks. Vitthal founded the Open Source project “Apache Ambari” and serve as a PMC member and Committer for it in Apache open source foundation. Vitthal is also the main contributor to Vaidya – a performance advisor framework for MapReduce.
results.name: Malhar&Geode Integration; Ingestion: Kafka to Hadoop/Apex & Geode

results.description:
March 18, 2016

Learn Elevator Pitch Tips for Better Business Networking

Andrew Winig, ImprovAndy

Your next big client could be standing right next to you. How will you answer the question, “What do you do?” In his dynamic and interactive presentation at the North Shore Business Forum’s meeting on March 18, Andrew Winig of ImprovAndy will help you learn and practice answering the only three questions you’ll ever be asked at any networking event. Andrew’s natural and conversational approach will open up more opportunities to grow your business and expand your referral network. You’ll also learn advanced techniques you can use immediately to start business conversations, discover relevant connections, and inspire prospects to call you.

 The North Shore Business Forum meets on Friday, March 18 at Acapulcos, 900 Cummings Center, Beverly, MA. Registration begins at 7:15 AM, the meeting runs from 7:30 to 8:30. Admission is $10 at the door, and includes a buffet breakfast. Visit www.nsbforum.org for more information.

About the Speaker: Andrew Winig is “Your Elevator Pitch Coach” and the owner of Arlington, MA-based ImprovAndy. As an entrepreneur and business owner, he discovered that business networking success starts with an engaging 30-second elevator pitch. His ten-year journey from cold-call salesman to trusted advisor inspired him to write the “Elevator Pitch Handbook: The Step-by-Step Guide to Starting Conversations.” Andrew wants you to get better leads from your elevator pitch, and shares his unique and effective techniques through email newsletters, webinars, one-on-one coaching, and keynote speeches. You can sign up for his weekly “Elevator Pitch Tips” email newsletter at ElevatorPitchTips.com. For more information, contact Andrew at [masked] or visit http://improvandy.com.

Note:  Pose will be the same as the Saturday 3-hour sessions, so if you want to get a REALLY long pose, sign up for both.  Jeremy Durling will host- Jeremy's paintings are available through the Sloane Merrill Gallery on Charles Street in Boston.  

Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $75, non-members for $90.    Four hours each Friday morning, 10:00- 2:00pm. You can come individual days by paying $20 (members) or $30 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at

http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html


PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $70 or $85 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.

results.description:
Help us improve free software user experience! Join us the day before LibrePlanet for this event.

SpinachCon is an afternoon-long open house aimed at improving the experience of using and contributing to free software projects. Volunteers come by and try out basic tasks provided by participating projects.


This year, we'll be doing two types of testing: user testing and new contributor testing. Volunteers can try out either or both types of testing. Every project at the event will have at least two people representing it, so volunteers can get to know - and get help from - the people behind the projects.

This is SpinachCon's second year. If you'd like to learn more about the event, check out this blog post.

Please RSVP here, or by emailing [masked] directly. Thanks!

* SpinachCon event page on LibrePlanet website

http://meetu.ps/2MwL3f

results.description:
This walk is on a paved path through the woods. This path is stroller friendly or you could carry your child. It is a little hilly, but appropriate for most fitness levels. We alternate walks between the inner and outer loops which are both under 3 miles. It usually takes less than an hour. We walk past a playground too, so we could stop and play there for a while. Afterwards, we sit at the picnic tables under the trees by the visitor center and feed our babies, chat, etc. 

We will meet outside the visitor center in the upper parking lot on the Saugus side of the park, past the Kasabuski Skating Rink.  There are bathrooms with a changing table in the visitor center too.

Running late?  No prob. We'll wait about 15 minutes before starting the walk.  Running really late? You can always meet up with us at the picnic tables next to the visitor center after we finish the walk.  

***By popular demand this is set as weekly event.  If the weather is bad we can change it to a different day or skip the week.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be the group with the strollers hanging out in front of the visitor center.

results.description:
Join us the day before LibrePlanet to help us improve free software user experiences during the second annual SpinachCon pre-event! Along with Sandstorm and the open source software it hosts, we'll be testing out and providing feedback for Inkscape, Public Lab, Dataverse, MediaGoblin.


SpinachCon is an afternoon-long open house aimed at improving the experience of using and contributing to free software projects. You are welcomed to come in and leave whenever you please from 12:30 to 5pm. When you come in, you'll have an opportunity to try out and give feedback on the participating open-source projects. This year, we'll be doing two types of testing: user testing and new contributor testing. You are welcome to try out either or both types of testing. And for Sandstorm, we will welcome feedback on Sandstorm and its apps. Every project at the event will have at least two people representing it, so you'll get to know - and get help from - the people behind the projects.

Things You'll Get: Some good food with Spinach of course :-)

Please RSVP on Meetup, and RSVP here too to make sure we plan for the right number of people, and of course, have enough food.

Our Code of Conduct: https://github.com/sandstorm-io/sandstorm/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

Let's meet a little early,before the MFA Turkish Festival film event, and hang out at the Taste Cafe and Wine Bar until showtime. This cafe is located on Level 1, directly across from the Remis Auditorium, next to the Bookstore and Shop.

Joana

results.description:
Let's enjoy the Annual Boston Flower & Garden Show for 2016! This is an AWESOME Event to attend ---if you LOVE Flowers and Gardening. This year it is from March 16--20th. This Event is co-hosted by the Japanese Flower Arranging Meetup.

So much to see! Do NOT miss the Japanese Flower Arranging section. You will be able to enjoy different styles of Japanese Flower Arranging.

Let's try to go together as a group. The Venue opens everyday at 10am. Let's meet there after work and enjoy the show! It is open every nite until 9pm. **Or go at your leisure any day**. Use the PROMO CODE below to save $4 on an All Day Adult Ticket.

There will be numerous gorgeous displays of flowers and plants galore. PLUS lectures + demos by experts. AND a lively marketplace featuring hundreds of beautiful and useful things to buy.

Full Day Tickets are $20. Use PROMO CODE: FS16JFA for a $4 Discount. After 5pm Tickets cost $15. (however must purchase at Box Office only) Go to: www.BostonFlowerShow.com to purchase your advance tickets. $4 Promo Code ONLY valid on advance online Full Day Tickets. Avoid Box Office lines and purchase Tix in advance online. No Service Fees.


If you can't make it exactly at 6pm---don't worry---still come and join us! We will be there. It takes quite a while to see and appreciate everything...

For more Info see: www.Meetup.com/Japanese-Flower-Arranging
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet INSIDE the Main Entrance where the Tix are sold. I will have a Meetup sign with me.
results.name: Boston Flower &Garden Show/DISCOUNT TIX  + Japanese Flower Exhibit--Enjoy!

<a href="https://www.google.com/maps/dir/"></a>

ONE Cantonese Event each Friday evening - with SEVERAL ACCOMPLISHED Cantonese speakers/teachers/guides - and THIS week at the Harvard Chan School of Public Health at 677 Huntington Avenue YMCA - Kresge Room # 202A.

The ONLY Kresge Building entrance TO US is the SIDE entrance at 677 Huntington Avenue.

The weekly Cantonese-English chat begins with a one-hour level 1 Cantonese language class followed by a free chat. 

Dandan 'Danni' Mai and Xiao 'Cecelia' Xiu, from the PRC (and NEU), host these friendly meetups, and Frankie Presta may also instruct. 


* Cantonese speakers want to practice English (and reduce their Chinese accents)?  
* English speakers want to learn Cantonese?  
* Nerdy Chinese folks want to bring friends and have a fun, FREE "outing" in Boston just talking with nerdy strangers in English or Cantonese?

Schedule: 
6:00 - 7:00PM - Cantonese class 
7:00 - 9:00PM - Bilingual free chat.

6:00 - 7:00 - 廣東話班
7:00 - 9:00 - 雙語談話

* Green Line E-Line comes above ground to Northeastern, then ride on the back car to Brigham Circle.  Get off, walk back, cross the street, then walk back again to the 677 banner.  Enter at THAT side/back entrance.
* Walking from the Orange Line takes about 5-10 minutes, walking through Northeastern University.
* Walking from Brookline is about 15 minutes.
* MFA, Wentworth, College, and Harvard's LMA are adjacent - on or off Huntington Avenue. 
* Route 9 comes near the area, via Brookline.
* Street parking is FREE from 6 pm onward (but not always easy to find).

By MBTA, get off at 

• Brigham Circle stop on Huntington Avenue E-Line (MBTA Green E) 
• Huntington Avenue stop on the #66 bus

results.description:
Cannabis Society is helping launch a new cannabis trade association in Massachusetts called the Northeast Cannabis Coalition with #StartupHigh!

#STARTUPHIGH will present the best of the best marijuana startups in the Northeast United States.  Network and hear pitches and great ideas. The future of the cannabis industry starts here.  Tickets are $10.00 plus the eventbrite fee online here https://startuphigher.eventbrite.com.  $10 at the door if you say you're a member of this meetup.   #StartupHigh sponsors include Tikun Olam, Kush Kards, CannaKorp, and Healthy Headie Lifestyle.  

#StartupHigh will gather leaders from the business, investment and entrepreneurial spaces to celebrate the vast potential of the cannabis industry by showcasing its rising stars based out of the northeast. Join the Northeast Cannabis Coalition, the brightest innovators, business investors, entrepreneurs and researchers as we present the best the industry has to offer.  

Innovator Opportunity

Participating entrepreneurs will pitch to a panel of expert judges and an audience of industry professionals, business owners, advocates and the general public. Each company will get 10 minutes to present their venture to the industry-centered crowd. If you are an entrepreneur or an innovator, you could be making a pitch to potential future investors or business partners. The Startup Showcase will be punctuated by discussions on the status of cannabis business and updates from industry leaders.  

Investor Opportunity

Meet the brightest minds in the space and learn about the new and innovative ideas that will shape the future of this industry. Become informed about the current state of cannabis businesses and hear about the latest trends and forecasts from expert investors and business owners.  Get to know the industry players in a friendly environment geared toward building connections and fostering collaboration with the broader innovation and investment communities.  

About Northeast Cannabis Coalition:  NCC is a non-profit trade association that represents the interests of marijuana related businesses and individuals in the northeast corridor of the United States. From NYC to Boston, the cannabis industry needs a voice to communicate with local, state and national stakeholders. The Northeast Cannabis Coalition strives to be that voice by encouraging new ideas within the cannabis community and creating a dialogue with established businesses as well as investment centers to bring more opportunities into the community at large.  http://www.necoalition.com/

About #StartupHigh: The northeast United States is the epicenter of finance, media, medicine, institutional knowledge, education and prudent startups. #StartupHigh will showcase inventive companies and ignite the beginning of the cannabis industrial revolution in our region.

Our #StartupHigh event series will showcase the best and brightest from the northeast cannabis startup community. Join us to learn about the booming industry and see our Startup Showcase, where up and coming cannabusinesses will present their ideas and pitch to an impressive audience made up of industry experts, business owners, investors, and professionals from all walks of life. 

About Cannabis: Cannabis is well known as a beneficial drug for cancer treatment, psychological and physical disorders and muscular ailments. Over the last decade, cannabis' myriad medical uses have slowly lead to a broader acceptance of adult consumption for wellness and recreation. In the last few years, reform has swept the nation with the promise of more to come. This expansion presents unprecedented economic opportunity for innovators looking to make a splash in these uncharted waters. The Northeast Cannabis Coalition is a non-profit trade association dedicated to ensuring that the northeast corridor of the US implements legalization in a manner that supports our local entrepreneurs and innovators while providing economic stability for our communities.  

Head to StartupHigh for the latest investment and entrepreneurial opportunities in all things cannabis.

Parking: There is a parking garage inside the Microsoft building at 1 Memorial Drive but if you want to explore more parking options around Microsoft check out Cambridge's parking guide on Parkopedia for information.  http://en.parkopedia.com/parking/cambridge/


Featured #StartupHigh JudgesLinda Stewart - Managing Partner of Sensible Alternative Investments

Linda is a successful CEO building high performing professional service companies.  She's built start-ups and run mature companies with revenues of over $400M.  Recognized as a positive, results and metrics driven leader, Linda builds effective loyal teams that consistently exceed performance targets.  She is a champion of highly engaged employee cultures and has been instrumental in successfully driving innovation in products, processes, and profits in diversified professional services businesses domestically and internationally. Linda is currently involved in two companies. She is a Managing Partner of Sensible Alternative Investments and the CEO of GatherEducation.Sensible Alternative Investments is a venture capital firm investing in ancillary businesses in the the cannabis industry and GatherEducation is an interactive virtual classroom for online learning. 

Robert Hunt - Lead Industry Executive of Tuatara Capital

Mr.  Hunt has more than 15 years of experience in the cannabis industry as an attorney, a consultant, and a serial entrepreneur.  Rob is currently a Partner, and the Lead Industry Executive of Tuatara Capital, the largest traditional private equity firm dedicated to cannabis based investments.  In this role Mr. Hunt is responsible for leading Tuatara’s deal generation efforts, operational due diligence, and execution of new investments.

As an expert in and an advocate for the cannabis industry, Mr.  Hunt has been a featured speaker at almost every major cannabis industry convention including NCIA, MJ Business, Marijuana Investor Summit, Weedstock and the Cannabis World Congress.  He has been interviewed by: Time, Entrepreneur Magazine, Fortune Magazine, Men’s Health, The Boston Business Journal, NBC News, ABC News, The Boston Herald, MMJ Business Daily, CNN Money, Businessweek, Mainstreet, Ozy, The cannabis Financial Network as well as numerous other publications and media outlets. He has authored articles for publications as diverse as Hydrolife Magazine, Urban Garden and the Medical Marijuana Business Daily (MMBD).  

Kris Krane - Managing Partner of 4Front Advisors

Having co-founded 4Front Advisors in 2011, Kris Krane serves as the Managing Partner of 4Front Advisors and President of 4Front Ventures. Prior to forming 4Front, Kris served as Director of Client Services for CannBe, which was a pioneer in developing best practices within the marijuana industry. At CannBe, Kris, along with a few other on the 4Front Advisors team, worked with many of the top licensed dispensary operators in Northern California.

Kris has dedicated his career to reforming the nation’s failed and misguided drug policies, having served as associate director of NORML from 2000- 2005 and executive director of Students for Sensible Drug Policy from 2006-2009. Kris earned a BA degree in political science from American University in 2000. Kris currently serves on the national board of directors for the National Cannabis Industry Association (NCIA), Common Sense for Drug Policy and Marijuana Majority, as well as the national advisory council for Students for Sensible Drug Policy.

Michael Dundas - CEO of Sage Cannabis, Inc.

Mr. Dundas is CEO of Sage Cannabis Inc., one of the original 9 medical marijuana licensees in Massachusetts. An expert in the medical marijuana industry, Mr. Dundas oversees all aspects of Sage operations including cultivation, extractions, product manufacturing, and sales. He is a founding member and Board Secretary of the Commonwealth Dispensary Association, a trade organization that represents the interests of Registered Marijuana Dispensaries in Massachusetts. Mr. Dundas was born and raised in Newton, and holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Political Science from the University of California at Berkeley, and a Juris Doctor Degree from the University of San Francisco School of Law. He is admitted to practice law in Massachusetts, New York and California.

Dr. Uma Dhanabalan - Principal at Total Health Care (THC)

Uma V.A. Dhanabalan, MD, MPH, FAAFP, MRO is a highly respected physician trained in Family Medicine and Occupational & Environmental Medicine. She is Board certified in Occupational Medicine, Medical Review Officer and Fellow of the American Academy of Family Physicians. She received her Medical Degree from the University of Medicine and Dentistry of Newark, New Jersey and her Master's Degree in Public Health specializing in Occupational & Environmental Medicine from the Harvard School of Public Health, Harvard University in Boston, Massachusetts.

Dr. Uma is actively involved with multiple organizations with her passion to educate the public and patients to empower with them knowledge. She is a Cannabis Therapeutics Specialist, doing Medical Marijuana authorizations, her passion is in educating the public about cannabis and endocannabinoid system. She has an array of patients from age 18 to 96, with various medical conditions who are using medical marijuana for treatment of their illnesses. She is also a Certified in Cannabis Medicine. Dr Dhanabalan states Cannabis is not an entrance drug, it is an exit drug for pharmaceuticals and narcotics.

Michael Kahn - President of MCR Labs

Michael is president and founder MCR Labs, an ISO-17025 accredited laboratory based in Framingham, MA. He obtained his Physics and Chemistry degrees from Brandeis University and Boston University. He has spoken publicly for the right of MMJ consumers to access testing results that current scientific practices can provide.

MCR Labs' team of analytical chemists and pharmaceutical scientists has helped thousands of patients through education, testing, and consulting. MCRL is working with the brightest partners in biotech to bring the best testing and research in the world to the cannabis community in New England. 

Mike Maloney - Chief Legal Counsel of Canna Care Docs

Mike is founder of Maloney and Molari and the chief legal counsel of Canna Care Docs and the President of CBD Thera. At Canna Care Docs, Mike ensures compliance with various state regulations in Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Maine, Connecticut, Delaware and the District of Columbia.  He helps facilitate MD/NP licensing in emerging markets and contract negotiation along with troubleshooting a variety of legal issues facing the cannabis industry.  


Nat Averill - CEO of Healthy Pharms, Inc.

Nathaniel Averill has worked in the biotech pharmaceutical industry for over twenty years. He has managed operations as well as designing and starting up large facilities across the northeast. Nat decided to open a medical marijuana dispensary not only to fulfill a dream of starting his own company but to also to have a more direct impact on the health of patients. He is currently using the skills used to develop systems that held up to FDA and EMEA audits to develop systems to control the quality and consistency of the products to be produced at Healthy Pharms.

Featured Startups 

Ardent Cannabis

Ardent is a Boston-based biotech and medical cannabis device company with pioneering technologies that drastically improve cannabis administration and effectiveness. With a team of partners skilled in all aspects of manufacturing from advanced thermal engineering to elite electronics, Ardent produces the NOVA™, a laboratory-grade precision decarboxylator for medical cannabis patients. Ardent's novel dosing vehicles, including its proprietary sublingual wraps and edible capsules allows any user to go from plant to accurate theraputics in one step. 

#StartupHigh MC and Presenter Shanel Lindsay, Esq. 

Shanel Lindsay is an attorney, inventor, and cannabis advocate. Shanel graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and Northeastern University School of Law and began her career as a judicial law clerk for the Massachusetts Superior Court. She then joined the Boston law firm of Sugarman, Rogers, Barshak and Cohen, serving as a civil litigator for Fortune 500 companies in the areas of business, insurance, and employment law before becoming Employment Counsel and Director of Human Resources for the Massachusetts State Lottery Commission. Shanel is an active member of the National Bar Association, previously serving as Deputy Regional Director from[masked] and currently as a regional board member. A founding member and Vice-Chair of the Northeast Cannabis Coalition and ardent advocate for cannabis legalization on the east coast, Shanel is dedicated to improving public understanding of cannabis’ medicinal benefits. She is certain that with increased education, research, and reliable clinical data, patients and doctors—even those who have not previously considered cannabis as an option—will discover it is a legitimate, viable, and safe treatment.

VisionCare-IMMAD

VisionCare specializes in Alzheimer’s disease, Parkinson’s disease and cannabis as they relate to visual functioning.  The expertise includes treatment and disease monitoring using structural imaging of the retina and functional assessment of retina and the lateral geniculate brain structures.  IMMAD, Impairment Measurement:  Marijuana and Driving, is a product developed through VisionCare to determine fitness to drive secondary to cannabis consumption.  IMMAD uses striped square symbol displayed on a cell phone that is a fixed spatial and temporal frequency that varies in contrast.  It is a two-minute test in a cell phone.  The science is complex, but the test is simple.  The driver taps the screen when they see the square.  It measures retinal and lateral geniculate brain function.  A failure to see the blinking square is an indication of impairment severe enough to make driving unsafe.

Presenter Dr. Denise Valenti 

Dr. Denise A. Valenti is a residency-trained, low-vision/blind-rehabilitation optometrist who has worked closely with sensory impairment and the ability to safely drive as a clinical doctor.  She has additional education and expertise in the field of age-related neurodegenerative diseases with the emphasis on Parkinson's disease and Alzheimer's disease.  Her research has included the study of imaging of retinal neural tissue using Optical Coherence Tomography and functional assessment of neural processing in the visual system using Frequency Doubling Technology.  Dr. Valenti provided direct clinical care for more than 25 years and currently is active in research and consultation related to vision, aging, neuroprocessing, cannabinoids and cognitive functions.  The neurocognitive impact of cannabis is an active area of research as is the treatment potential for Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease.  She is the principal in the development of technology to detect impairment in the retina and lateral geniculate brain nuclei from cannabis consumption, Impairment Measurement: Marijuana and Driving or IMMAD.  Dr. Valenti holds an adjunct faculty position at the MCPHS University School of Optometry.

CannaKorp 

CannaKorp’s™ patent-pending vaporizer technologies, CannaCloud™ and CannaCup™, are the first to deliver medicinal cannabis in a single-use, dose-controlled portion pack.  This quality-assured, convenient and consistent system makes the entire experience easier and more consumer-friendly.  We are attracting mainstream people who have yet to enter the legal medicinal market – as well as current connoisseurs – just like single-serve coffee pods transformed the coffee market.

The CannaCloud™ system extracts the medically beneficial compounds more efficiently while simultaneously offering a much safer and enjoyable experience than other alternatives.  As a patient once said, “you are taking this out of the dark and into the light.”

Presenter Michael Bourque

Michael is the inventor of the CannaCloud™ system and is responsible for future innovation at CannaKorp™ Michael is an insatiable inventor who balances creative ideation with critical analysis, modeling and testing his innovations until they exceed his expectations in terms of performance and usability. Before founding CannaKorp™ Michael served in various capacities at PTC, a $1.3 billion global software company. Over a period of 14 years, he worked as manager of quality assurance, product definition, director of two product development groups, and finally vice president of PTC University where he managed global teams in India, Israel, China, the UK, and the US.  Prior to PTC, Michael was a machinist and computer robotics programmer for 12 years at MIT’s famed Lincoln Laboratory. In addition, Michael leads several technical conferences, bringing industry enthusiasts together to educate and share ideas surrounding thinking differently for innovation and to improve the user experience. A husband and father of three, Michael is a skilled and avid musician, songwriter, filmmaker, and cook.

Yofumo Technologies

Yofumo Technologies will lead the IoT space within the cannabis industry. Their first product, YoBox, is a "smart" cannabis humidor launching this April. YoBox allows consumers to securely store cannabis at the optimal temperature and humidity levels, while also killing any bacteria and mold via cutting-edge ozone technology. Yofumo also monitors key metrics within the YoBox and will automatically match consumers with local dispensaries, caregivers, and delivery services when their cannabis supply is running low. The YoBox is the first of several products coming from Yofumo Technologies. Other products in the pipeline include a hand-held cannabinoid reader, a "smart" vaporizer, and commercial grow ozone sanitation systems.

Presenter Brendan Carroll

Brendan Carroll is co-founder and COO of Yofumo Technologies. Irked by corporate america, Brendan left JP Morgan 6 years ago to focus on early-stage technology companies. He is passionate about innovation, entrepreneurship and, above all, the customer experience. In his free time, Brendan is an avid reader, traveler, golfer, and skier. Brendan is a Boston native and is actively involved in its startup ecosystem. 

SecureDEA

We at SecureDEA, have developed an easy to use, online application which will safeguard your shipments between either Growing Facilities, Distribution Facilities, Dispensaries, Patients (Home Deliveries) or all four if needed. Our Application will meet and exceed your state regulations regarding the transportation of medical marijuana and other cannabis related products (MIP's).

Presenter Jesse Rozell

Mr. Rozell, a Navy veteran, proudly served his country for over a decade as an Information Security and transportation (INFOSEC) expert.  He oversaw the transfer and security of classified material, both print and non-print formats.  He was also responsible for the storage, procedural requirements and enhancements of classified material.  Mr. Rozell received many distinguished awards while serving in the armed forces including the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal, National Defense Service Medal, Global War on Terrorism Service Medal, and the Navy Meritorious Unit Commendation Medal among others.

Presenter Mauricio Guerra

Co-founders Mauricio Guerra and Jesse Rozell bring over three decades of experience in banking, information security and transportation to SecureIDEA.  Mr. Guerra is a Certified Public Accountant and spent over 15 years working for Banco Popular of Puerto Rico and Citibank N.A.  He developed complex credit and cash management solutions for Fortune 500 companies and government agencies to ensure compliance with the Patriot Act, FinCen, OFAC,  BSA-AML and other regulations.

Social High 

Social High is the Facebook for the Cannabis Community, but more! Where Weedmaps and Leafly tell you what retailers have which strains, Social High uses the Sharing Economy model listing what members nearby have what strains so they can meet up and match strains. Our strain details are powered by our relationship with Leafly! Social High offers chat that disappears in 24 hours, anonymous profiles for privacy, and Airbnb-style ratings for users who have a session together. Our revenue model is an advertising model for any businesses seeking to reach cannabis users within a radius they define, modeled after the business pages offered by Facebook. Our mobile application is currently available on both the IOS and Android platforms.

Presenter Scott Bettano 

Having spent over 10 years in the MEP consulting and construction industries, Scott has built a diverse background of engineering trade skills to compliment his dynamic project management style, sales and business development skill set.

During his extensive professional career, Scott also became deeply involved in the Cannabis Black Market, culminating in an arrest for Marijuana possession in 2012.

Scott is  now combining his professional experience and extensive knowledge of the cannabis market to venture into the rapidly growing legal cannabis industry. Partnered with some of the top mobile application development talent in the country, we at Social High are building a social media experience for members of the Cannabis Community to connect with others by geographic location and strain preference.

Healthy Headie Lifestyle

HEALTHY HEADIE LIFESTYLE is the only in-home, direct sales, and demonstration company for the vape lifestyle. What does that mean? No trips to the smoke shop. We bring the store to your door, in the comfort and privacy of your own home. We set up a customized consult where we review top of the line vaporizer devices, tools, and accessories.  Healthy Headie Lifestyle is proud to have been a part of the inaugural class at CanopyBoulder, the industry's first startup accelerator along with winning the Best Pitch Award at ArcView Denver 2015.

Presenter Ross Bradshaw 

Ross Bradshaw is the Director of Operations of Healthy Headie Lifestyle as well as a Board Certified Public Accountant and Lean Six Sigma Green Belt. He received both his accounting degree and Masters in Business Administration from Providence College. Prior to joining Healthy Headie Lifestyle, Ross’ background included several years of experience in auditing, finance, and consulting, first at PriceWaterhouseCoopers completing compliance audits for industry leading Not-for-profit and Pharmaceutical companies, and then at Bose Corporation where he performed corporate wide operation assessments and risk management.

In addition to his corporate experience, Ross has several years of experience in the cannabis industry as an advocate, investor, and entrepreneur.  Ross’ experience includes previously serving on the MassCann/NORML Board of Directors as Treasurer, partaking in Massachusetts 2013 medical marijuana dispensary application process, and most recently participating in the first ever cannabis business accelerator, CanopyBoulder, located in Boulder, Colorado with his colleagues from Healthy Headie. 


iRollie

Here at iRollie we believe life’s beauty should be experienced up close and personal. So, we engineered a phone case that allows you to roll one anywhere you find yourself on this earth. Trivial things like scrambling for a flat surface to roll on, or trying to collect fallen tobacco forces you to miss out on some of the most beautiful moments. That is why we have brought the perks of a rolling tray to the back of your phone. Now, you will be able to enjoy these moments in life a little more, and worry about rolling one up a little less to keep the adventure rolling!

Presenter Joe Khoury

Joe Khoury is a young entrepreneur and student at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. He started his first venture at 16 selling his design services. He accrued the clientele of record labels seeking album art, and artist seeking apparel designs. Following the beginning of his college career, Joseph interned at the largest startup accelerator in the world, MassChallenge. He became infatuated with entrepreneurship, and there has been no turning back. While maintaining his impressive GPA and studies, Joe founded iRollie last March, and has since been featured in High Times magazine and other publications, in addition to accruing the clientele of Def Jam records. 


#StartupHigh Sponsors

Tikun Olam Medical Cannabis

Tikun Olam Ltd. is the first, largest and foremost supplier of medical Cannabis in Israel, and is one of leading medical cannabis companies in the world. The company is the flag bearer and pioneer of the treatment of patients with medical cannabis in Israel. Tikun Olam is privately held and has been operating under license from the Israel Ministry of Health since 2007.  http://www.tikun-olam.info/


Healthy Headie Lifestyle

HEALTHY HEADIE LIFESTYLE is the only in-home, direct sales, and demonstration company for the vape lifestyle.  OUR MISSION is to provide tools, resources and information to people interested in alternatives for their health. At Healthy Headie, we share the best of the best with our customers, working with top of the line manufactures, distributors, businesses and services. 

Healthy Headie Lifestyle is proud to have been a part of the inaugural class at CanopyBoulder, the industry's first startup accelerator along with winning the Best Pitch Award at ArcView Denver 2015.

http://www.healthyheadie.com/

Kush Kards

KushKards are the epitome of the traditional greeting card, enhanced with the capability to insert a pre-rolled item of choice. Specifically designed for pro-cannabis users, Kushkards takes the element of puff puff pass to a whole new level. With KushKards, customers have the opportunity to share with friends, family, coworkers or new acquaintances their common interest in a fun and unique way. Enhance your greeting card by removing the plastic insert and attaching a pre-roll to your Kushkard. Match strike on each card to light your pre-roll.

http://www.kushkards.nyc/

CannaKorp

CannaKorp’s™ patent-pending vaporizer technologies, CannaCloud™ and CannaCup™, are the first to deliver medicinal cannabis in a single-use, dose-controlled portion pack.  This quality-assured, convenient and consistent system makes the entire experience easier and more consumer-friendly.  We are attracting mainstream people who have yet to enter the legal medicinal market – as well as current connoisseurs – just like single-serve coffee pods transformed the coffee market.


About Microsoft New England our Venue Sponsor

Microsoft New England promotes research, software innovation & community in the heart of the northeast.  Bostonians are pretty clever folks. From Ben Franklin to the Big Dig–they’ve been solving difficult problems in creative ways for centuries. And today the Greater Boston area is home to cutting edge tech companies, world class hospitals, a vibrant startup community, plus a few universities you might have heard of. So when Microsoft needed the brightest minds to work on tomorrow’s technologies, Boston was the natural choice. And we love our New England home. The people. The ideas. The history. The culture. The food. It’s what makes us Microsoft New England.

https://microsoftnewengland.com/

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers, 


Let's watch Turkish comedy film, A Unique Life (Nadide Hayat), at the MFA.

It is a story of Nadide, a fifty-year-old woman who chose marriage over college and career, becomes increasingly bored and lonely after losing her husband. Her grown children rarely visit, and she can’t find fulfillment in any activity. One day, inspired by an article in the paper, she decides to enroll at a university. Her scholarly endeavor leads to an even bigger adventure: an ocean voyage with a group of young and mysterious captains.


http://www.mfa.org/programs/film/btff-excellence-in-turkish-cinema-award-a-unique-life


I strongly recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance. You may purchase your tickets online.  The cost is $9 for members and $11 for non-members.  Tickets go on sale Thursday, February 18 at 10 am, so mark your calendars. 

The film starts at 7:00 pm, however the meeting time for the group is set for 6:30 pm  pm at the entrance of the Remis Auditorium.  

The plan is to meet at 6:30 pm at the entrance of the auditorium and then  enter the auditorium to sit as a group at 6:45 pm.  I strongly recommend that you come early and join the pre-Meetup gathering for this event at the Taste Cafe. 

The auditorium is located inside the museum on Level 1.  Directly across from the auditorium, there is the Taste Cafe and Wine Bar.  I will schedule a separate event at this cafe for those who would like to meet early, starting at 1 pm, to have a snack or lunch before the film.

Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement. For events to be successful, I need to know who to expect and how many.  


This is a public event and you are certainly free to attend this event outside the Meetup group.  I just ask  that only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending this event and intend to meet members of the group.  

If you reserve "YES", we will be expecting you.  If you reserve "YES" and then have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group.  

As for parking, and directions, I strongly recommend that you take public transportation, the Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Visit these links for more information on getting to the museum and parking: http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

I look forward to seeing you at the MFA.

Joana

***Additional Film Information***


A Unique Life (Nadide Hayat) by Çağan Irmak (2014, 118 min). 


Nadide, a fifty-year-old woman who chose marriage over college and career, becomes increasingly bored and lonely after losing her husband. Her grown children rarely visit, and she can’t find fulfillment in any activity. One day, inspired by an article in the paper, she decides to enroll at a university. Her scholarly endeavor leads to an even bigger adventure: an ocean voyage with a group of young and mysterious captains.

A discussion with the director will follow the screening.

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt5065790/


To view trailer, </a><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U_Lnqd9KtYY">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U_Lnqd9KtYY

http://www.mfa.org/programs/film/btff-excellence-in-turkish-cinema-award-a-unique-life

results.description:
The phenomena of qualia will be the subject of our philosophy of mind meeting.

The meeting will be divided into two parts.  In the first part, we will try to arrive at consensus as to what we mean by qualia and quale.  In the second part, we will try to determine whether the existence of qualia provides any support for dualism or for a refutation of materialism.

‘Qualia’ is the word frequently used to refer to those special, private, existential feelings that we all have. We have these feelings just by being alive and experiencing the world. The experience you have of being conscious is similar to the feelings you have of qualia. The difference is that your feelings of qualia are associated with specific perceptions. For example, painfulness is the quale associated with pain. That is, the painfulness of pain is a special, private, existential feeling. 

Michael Tye says, “Philosophers often use the term ‘qualia’ (singular ‘quale’) to refer to the introspectively accessible, phenomenal aspects of our mental lives. In this broad sense of the term, it is difficult to deny that there are qualia. Disagreement typically centers on which mental states have qualia, whether qualia are intrinsic qualities of their bearers, and how qualia relate to the physical world both inside and outside the head. The status of qualia is hotly debated in philosophy largely because it is central to a proper understanding of the nature of consciousness. Qualia are at the very heart of the mind-body problem.” (Ref 1)

Joseph Levine says, “Qualia are part of the phenomenon of the subjectivity of consciousness, and pose one of the most difficult problems for a materialist solution to the mind-body problem.” (Ref 2)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~.

1. “Qualia”
Michael Tye, University of Texas
Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy
http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/qualia/ 

2. “Qualia”
Joseph Levine, University of Massachusetts Amherst
Encyclopedia of Philosophy, Second Edition (2005) 

http://files.meetup.com/331299/%27Qualia%27%20Encyl%20of%20Phil%20%282005%29.pdf


3. “Qualia”
Amy Kind, Claremont McKenna College
Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy
http://www.iep.utm.edu/qualia/

4. “Three Laws of Qualia”
Ramachandran and Hirstein
Journal of Consciousness Studies, 4, 1997, pp. 429–58

http://files.meetup.com/331299/Three%20Laws%20of%20Qualia%20%281997%29.pdf

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Donations:

To help support the Democracy Center, a voluntary donation, of a few dollars, will be requested at the meeting.
results.name: Qualia – That Special Feeling

results.description:
"You don’t have to change yourself to meet the expectations of others. Seek out those that not only accept you but celebrate you for who you are...

Give your time and energy to those who are committed to truth, the brave souls working toward a life of authenticity.

Let them be your tribe, and you their family. Open yourself to connections born from a pledge to be real." — Scott Stabile

Using the Salon* format for group conversation and discussion, Tender Hearts and Old Souls is designed for those  wishing  to connect with others yearning to explore, question and discuss beyond surface chit chat, such topics as kindness, suffering, compassion,  forgiveness, love, and other topics that stir the human heart. In a world where sound bites on social media or the news have a tendency to shape our beliefs about others and equally as harmful, our feelings about ourselves; it is  a place to engage in conversation that lifts the spirit and reminds us  in the words of Ram Dass, "We are all just walking each other home."

If you have longed for a place to belong, a place where being “too sensitive” is a blessing and not a curse, and the desire to engage in spirited conversation , then you are invited to come as you are, even if it's to first just listen....your tribe awaits.

*A Salon is when a group of kindred spirits gathers to exchange ideas and discuss issues they care deeply about.  The group facilitator will begin the salon by inviting members to share what they are currently thinking about a particular topic.  The facilitator finds the common thread and the discussion begins. Members of the group shape the discussion. The facilitator can also bring in guest speakers and or activities that correspond with issues members are most passionate about.
results.name: A Conversation Place for Tender Hearts and Old Souls

results.description:
I know you’re busy!  There are so many other places you could be on a Friday night.  Stop by, eat some food, pretend to be interested,  learn a few moves, and get to your party.

Its free to students

(Donations are welcomed.  college students like to eat)

This is a group of graduate students who are trying to make a difference.  They are learning about how to run a business by providing a service. 

Inspiration for this training:

As a US service member stationed abroad, I witnessed first-hand a very bad situation in Asia. With hundreds of people running around in a mental and physical state of panic, no one knew what to do.   Trained and proficient in response to active shooter.  I was unable to share the proper solution to the victims or local law enforcement because area the area quickly became blocked off.  I unfortunately found out that doing nothing will stay with you forever.  I now have a team of extremely dedicated graduate students who are committed to getting the message out back here in the United States. There is Safety through Education.  This is our cause we will be relentless at sharing this information.    This is how we keep America great

Why should you come:

To support this graduate team of MBA students practicing their craft

If you are a member of faculty then you need the training more than the student

Remember the support you needed for your first lemonade stand

Keep America great by a higher state of preparedness  

Learn to protect yourself and others at parties or in your place of business

Because you can

Get free food

The event is free to students

Free raffle for the Irish inspired guest

Disclaimer:  Same rules apply as when you are in class there will be no alcohol during the entire event.  Anyone displaying signs or symptoms will politely asked to leave.

Disclaimer:  There are no limits to the amount of donations.

What are we going to be doing?

We are going to teach students and small business how to protect themselves as individuals and as a group.

We will provide situational awareness training. After the training, you will have learned some leadership skills and a mental frame of reference as to what to do in an unfortunate situation while at school, business or home. Class will be taught in English and instructors will also translate into Chinese, Portuguese and Hindi for further clarification. Many of our families worry about our safety while we are here learning in school or working employees in the United States. Great fun serious subject.

This is a fun light hearted hands on training of what to do in bad situation while with a group of people or as an individual. If you are a student or a small business, being prepared is paramount.
Our Learning objectives:

Situational awareness
Frame of reference
Run, Hide, Fight
Leadership

Format of training will consist of one half lecture and  one half hands on.
This will be an informal event so dress comfortable/business relaxed.
We have a English, Chinese, Brazilian, and Hindi speaking instructors
results.name: Fun Safety Training for Students, Small Businesses and "de" Irish Inspired

results.description:
Kangoo Jumps is one of the latest fitness crazes catching on across the country.  It's an amazing workout for people who are interested in losing weight and building strength. Great for those who want a high intensity cardio workout with far less impact to their joints. Kangoo jumps can burn up to 50% more calories than traditional workouts.

                                                    Meetup Details:


Organizer/Event Host:
Jenna  (SHC)

Kangoo Jumps Instructor:
Wendel C.

Sponsored by:
Kangoo Jumps Club - MA.


Choreography Level:
Easy, basic steps, entry level

Cardio Level:
High Intensity Workout

Location:
Abington

Cost:
$15.00 with Kangoo rental - $10.00 without rental, * Special rate pricing avail to SSH&B/SHC members only.


Attendance Limit:
10 members, limit may increase as needed later.

Gear/Clothing:
Bring 2 pairs of thick socks, similar to those you would wear hiking (wool or wicking). Wear supportive clothing, a good sports bra & bring water. 

Kangoo Rental Sizes:

Small - Womens 4-6 or Mens 3-5
Medium - Womens 6-9 Mens 6-8
Large - Womens 10-12 Mens 9-11
XLarge - Womens 12+, Mens 12-15

Action Required After RSVP:
Please add your Kangoo size to the comments board so that I can arrange to have them onsite for the class.


Communications:
I'll arrive on site early and will use the meetup board to communicate. I'll send my contact info to those that RSVP. Please use text when contacting me if poss.


Misc but Important:
- What happens in Kangoo club stays in Kangoo club - pls don't video tape anyone the without their consent, pics are fine

- There is no secure place to put your things, open lockers are right by the front door so leave your valuables in car or at home.

- Bring cash/exact change (if possible) to expedite 

- Bring a healthy snack with you for the ride home.

- Zumba class lets out prior to the Kangoo classes, there may not be much room to in the foyer to wait around for Zuma to end. I like to wait until the Zuma class exits the building before entering.

- You can not just show up at this event without an RSVP. Kangoos are brought to the location based on your RSVP & size + class size must be controlled due to type of activity. 

Prereqs:
Anyone with basic concepts of aerobics, step, boxing or zumba/dance and enjoys a high intensity cardio workout.

Future Kangoo Jump Events:
Kangoo jump weekend hikes will be posted to meetup under Southeastern Hiking Club (SHC) starting in May. 

Disclaimer:
During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. Meetup hosts, organizers, assistant organizers, leaders, guides and sponsors are not responsible for the safety of participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge and agree to this statement.
results.name: Kangoo Jumps Workout

venue.name: The Wild Rover - by Faneuil Hall

results.description:
PLEASE DO NOT DOUBLE RSVP! ----PLEASE RSVP IN ONE GROUP ONLY!! 

Join the legendary crazy dancing at our Mix +Mingle Meetup Private Party for 120+ members with our own DJ, dance area, 2 bars +apps/food from 7-9PM.

7-9PM is the Social Mixer which the best because it allows you to get to know your fellow Meetup members. After 9PM the crazy dancing + loud music starts so please do not complain, since members come to dance to loud music after 9PM.

Bonus FREE KARAOKE on 1st  floor if you want to kick it KARAOKE style.

Its the party everyone loves since its he starting point for thousands of new friendships, real long term relationships and 57+ marriages. Remember this is not a Singles Party it's a Social party.

The BEST part!...Come between 7 and 8:20PM to get 1 included (FREE) drink ticket good for any beer, wine, or mixed drink! (Sorry no shots or top-shelf liquor). This 1 Drink ticket will expire at 8:20PM sharp!!.....Please don't forget to TIP your bartender for the included drink! 

When you arrive please head upstairs, (please don't block the stairway). Meet/greet Biagio, say your first name, what group you're with, pay with a $10 bill in hand at the top of the stairs (no $1 or $5 bills, please). You'll get a wrist bands to  so you can go upstairs and downstairs.

1. Biagio collects $10 cash from everyone, but the invited Larger Meetup Group Head Organizers and some of the  Social Fun Organizers..

2. After 9 PM you'll have to pay the bar's cover charge, so stretch your dollar and come before 9PM. If you get in before 9PM you ONLY have to pay $10 to Biagio.

I hope you can all join us for this blast of a party. It should be fun so thanks and enjoy life!..........Ciao, Biagio (a new dad)

==========================================================

Special Wild Rover Venue Update: Members under age 21 are NOT admitted. They MUST CHECK Valid ID, Driver License or Passports. If you don't present it they can't let you in sorry. NO large luggage or suitcases/boxes allowed in this venue.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Parking for this event: Street parking can be tough so you can try it and of course it's hit or miss. Your best bet it take the T.

The closet T stop is the Aquarium stop on the Blue line, next would be State Street stop on the Orange line.

If you really must drive in and park then there is $10 Parking after 5PM and on weekends at International Place Garage . There is a coupon that lowers it to $7 but this  $7 coupon is accepted at Pay Station in building lobby ONLY.  http://bostonparking.spplus.com/Boston-1-International-Place-Parking.html
results.how_to_find_us: We rented the whole 2nd floor of the Wild Rover to make this an awesome private party Look for Biagio at the top of the stairs.
results.name: Boston Mix n Mingle 2016 Spring Party for 120 Members from 9+ Meetup Groups

results.description:
https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/ZcFH6UdB7zaCs9fq_NQVrcx5S88hI7Ww6dNgW-624AUu9OVHRnoD__ZXe71Yz_xObzd08-zNl2ltA1SYy1RjPo9Xv4OdcAlBdkl7VXWLsXxNH9I1sjWtVgzCXuGibsoDnXvf-G1z

Credit to the People
From Money Controlling People - to People Controlling Money

A Participatory, Dynamic, Community Building Seminar to address the problems with our money system and proposed solutions.

Solutions include Mutual Credit and Sociocracy, Public Banks, Interdependence Funds, and eventually restructuring the Federal Reserve System.

Do you know who issues the dollars we all have to use?  Do you know what they are issued for?  Do you know when they are issued?  Do you know who regulates the money supply and for what purpose?  Do you know why the Federal Debt never gets paid off?  Do you know why the system requires continual growth and why we deplete our natural resources at such an alarming rate? Do you know why you don’t know the answers to these questions?  Do you know why even most bankers do not know the answers to these questions?

The culture would have us believe that our problems are a result of human nature.  However, by highlighting your life experiences, we can demonstrate that the problems we face arise from the distortion of human nature brought about by the way money is issued and mis-allocated.  If we issue money to capitalize what we value and want to dedicate our lives to, then the economy and society will reflect our values and capitalize our capacities.  

Come join us for a genuine community building experience as we explore the work that a small, dedicated group has developed over the past four years.  We will learn together about Concordian Economics and how to issue money to create communities dedicated to the common good.

We will gather on Friday Evening March 18th from 7 to 10 pm, and all day Saturday March 19, 2016 from 10 am to 5 pm at 99 Crescent Street, Newton (Auburndale), MA 02466, where each day we will enjoy a vegetarian buffet: $20 dinner from 7 to 8 pm on 3/18, and $15 lunch from 12 to 1 pm on 3/19. Requested donation for Credit To The People: $25.

For more information and to rsvp, go to: http://www.meetup.com/Whole-Health-Dinners-Gatherings-and-Presentations/events/228874452/ or contact Margaret Arndt at[masked] or <a>[masked]</a>, or John Root at[masked] or <a>[masked]</a>.  

Check out www.credittothepeople.org for general information about monetary reform.

This seminar is for educational purposes only.
results.name: Credit to the People; From Money Controlling People to People Controlling Money
