results.description:
Come and make a coaster/decoration (3 ¾ square wood), light switch cover, or two mosaic pendants! Learn to use the mosaic wheeled cutters and nippers to shape glass pieces. Your project can be completed in one session and grout will be given to you to finish at home, or you can sign up for another session to complete your project in class. 

Ask your co-workers and/or friends to join you are make friends while you are there! We always have a wonderful group of women!  


Only $38 and all materials are included, just bring yourself and an adult beverage and friends if you like! You will leave with your own work of art and wonderful memories! 

Some come for one class and others stay for years! I offer four and ten-class packages at different time for all schedules. 

To register go to my website, www.cherylcohenmosaics.com and check out my amazing students on my Facebook page "Cheryl Cohen Mosaics!"

results.description:
Meetup at MetroRock Gym in Everett, offering both toprope and lead


Meet at the left-side hexagonal picnic table next to the bench and cubbies.

I (Jens) will go up to the picnic table area from 7 - 7:15 PM to meet people who prefer to show up at the regular MeetUp time. Please check  the whiteboard near the bathrooms for a description of what I'm wearing. If anyone else arrives early, please write "MEETUP" and your name & what you are wearing on the Whiteboard.

If you have not already done so, please post a clear face picture of yourself on your profile so that I and other members can recognize you.

If arriving later, just come find us on the walls. Hopefully you can recognize me (see "Event Host" right) from my picture.

If you've never climbed here before, you'll need to take & pass a belay test for rope climbing. Call the gym or see the website below for more info. Full-access Day Pass $22. Bouldering-Only Pass $18. Free pizza for students.

More info and directions: http://www.metrorock.com/
results.how_to_find_us: At the picknic table next to the cubbies
results.name: MetroRock FRIDAY

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

7:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

7:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

7:20 - Play!!!!!!

9:00 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: The field is right next to Alewife station on the Red Line. There is also plenty of parking provided no one else is using the field. (Not an issue in the winter.)

results.description:
Theme for this session:

“Through the Eyes of Love”: Connecting to Deep Love – for Your Self and Others

Come join us to experience pure love inside and out, and all around! Don’t worry; we’ll make it easy!

I'll guide you through three meditations (with some instruction and discussion, too): one bringing love into your body; one on seeing yourself through the eyes of love; and one called “Spirit’s Kisses”.

My intention is to connect you to your true, magnificent Self and all the love available to you. Sound good?  If so, join us, and invite your friends and family to join us, too!

From a past session:

“I’m leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!!”

To encourage and support your practice and our community, if you pay for 4 guided meditation sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  You can also choose to pay for one class at a time for $20. These fees help to cover all of my costs and the significant time I put into running and preparing for all of the events and the meetup itself. Thank you!

Please RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner. Feel free to invite family and friends, too!

End time is approximate, as we often run over-time, and I welcome some "hang out and chat" time before leaving.


Here's the basic description and format for all of our guided meditation sessions, with a more specific focus/theme each time we meet, as well.  Of course, you do not have to commit to attending every time, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit; and the better we'll get to know each other!

Guided Meditations for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY!

Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

I also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self, and to access all that it has to offer you.

By participating in these transformational group guided meditations, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

• Techniques to help you release stress and anxiety, and to shift your perspective and experience of those issues to a more positive perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each time we meet to help you build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

We typically have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy. It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment.  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations! I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

"I truly value our time together. I tried two other guided meditation classes with other instructors, and I enjoy your classes the most. Why? Because you give us time to reflect, journal and share. It really helps to deepen my experience and expand my perspective. And honestly, I relate more to your meditations and love the sound of your voice. Your guided meditations are like group therapy for the soul."

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., has been leading guided meditation classes for years, and is also a certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.

results.description:
Another day, another live music venue is closing. What is going on? Are audiences abandoning the live music experience? How should music be presented in today's modern world? Is there still a need for a performing musician? And what can you do as a participant or musician?

Join our co-founder and Executive Director David Day as he accesses his 20 yers in the music business to discuss how we can rescue the live music experience.

David Day is a retired DJ. After spinning nearly everywhere in Boston for 10 years, he hung up his headphones after opening the Mmmmaven Project, a DJ lab in Central Square, Cambridge. From being the music editor, then editor, of DigBoston, to managing a record store, to promoting and publicity, Day has done it all. Twelve years ago he started the weekly club party Make It New.

The Transformation of the Live Music Venue
Friday, March 18th
7pm
Free
Mmmmaven
614 Massachusetts Avenue #203
Cambridge, MA 02139
results.name: The Transformation of the Live Music Venue [Fri 3/18]

results.description:
Join us for our monthly Kabbalat Shabbat celebration at the historic Vilna Shul. This March we welcome Jill and Jackie Schon, founders of the wildly successful Paint Bar event spaces as our very special co-guest speakers.

Festivities begin with wine and appetizers on the main floor at 6:30. We head upstairs to the sanctuary for an egalitarian Shabbat service led by members of our community, followed by a discussion with our honored guest speakers, before finally heading back downstairs for a laid-back, inviting kosher buffet dinner.

New faces are always welcome at Havurah on the Hill, so bring your friends!

Suggested donation $10.00 per person.

Schedule of Events: 
6:30 PM Wine and Appetizers 
7:00 PM Shabbat Services 
8:15 PM Discussion with Featured Speakers, Jill and Jackie Schon 
8:45 PM Kosher Buffet Shabbat Dinner 
(vegetarian and gluten free options available)
results.name: Young Adult Kabbalat Shabbat with Paint Bar Founders Jill and Jackie Schon

group.name: Awesome Jewish Cultural Events in Boston - Open to all!

results.description:
Please join us to watch and discuss the 5th episode of BELIEF, a groundbreaking 7-part documentary series that aired on the OWN network in October.

BELIEF is an exploration of the power of our diverse belief systems, faith practices and cultural traditions that connect us to ourselves, sustain us through the most challenging times and bind us closer together in community with one another. Oprah has described this series as the very reason she founded a television network - to be able to share stories that connect people together.

This series highlights stories of people from around the world, diverse in their beliefs, but united by a deep desire to find purpose and meaning in their lives. It journeys to the far reaches of the world, illuminating sacred places and practices that will engage believers of any faith or none at all.

Our goal is that engaging in these questions and conversations together draws us to a place of deepened intercultural understanding and greater healing. Our hope is that this series can act as a catalyst to start and/or deepen intercultural and interfaith communication, trust building and partnership.

The gathering is free of charge. A facilitated discussion will follow the episode, inviting you to explore the beliefs and practices that bring meaning to your own life.

For more information about the series, or to watch the 2-minute trailer, visit http://beliefteam.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be right in the sanctuary...come in through the large glass doors in the front of the spiritual center on 13 Common Street in Natick Center across from the town green.
results.name: Community Watch Party: What Do You Believe?

BELIEF is an exploration of the power of our diverse belief systems, faith practices and cultural traditions that connect us to ourselves, sustain us through the most challenging times and bind us closer together in community with one another. 

This series highlights stories of people from around the world, diverse in their beliefs, but united by a deep desire to find purpose and meaning in their lives. It journeys to the far reaches of the world, illuminating sacred places and practices that will engage believers of any faith or none at all.

Our goal is that engaging in these questions and conversations together draws us to a place of deepened intercultural understanding and greater healing. Our hope is that this series can act as a catalyst to start and/or deepen intercultural and interfaith communication, trust building and partnership.

The gathering is free of charge. A facilitated discussion will follow the episode, inviting you to explore the beliefs and practices that bring meaning to your own life.

For more information about the series, or to watch the 2-minute trailer, visit http://beliefteam.com/

results.description:
We are learning more and more as a culture that orgasm and connection are essential nutrients; we humans need those nutrients just as much as we need air, water, love, or food. But most of us are deeply deficient—starved really—of these nutrients of orgasm and connection. There is a kind of efforting in many of the ways we attempt to connect with others, whether co-workers, acquaintances, lovers, or friends. Often it feels so frustrating that we just give up. We walk around in a life that feels dry, crunchy, or worse, numb.

But we know something more is available, because we hit pockets of flow—that oneness state where we suddenly feel powerfully connected to ourselves, the world, and others. It can happen on a ski slope, in a music performance, or during a peak moment in sex, but then it’s gone and we don’t know how it happened nor how to recreate it. The fleeting nature of those moments can even make us feel more resigned to the day to day ordinariness of feeling something is just not quite right.

What can we do to be able to access the nutrients of orgasm and connection? What does it take to feel that emptiness begin to fill? Even more, how can we live from that fullness all the time?

Join your Boston OM Center Orgasm Experts and community for a screening of a live talk given by Nicole Daedone, the founder of Orgasmic Meditation (OM). Her vibrancy, insight, wisdom, and love are palpable as she answers questions from the audience on everything from how being out of control can be a way to expand yourself, how to handle a partner when they’re flipped out in anger or fear, to how to tap into your deeper desires, where true nourishment can arise.

After the screening, you’ll have a chance to ask questions of us, your local Orgasm Experts, hear more about how to have orgasm and authentic connection in your life whenever you want it, and how to learn Orgasmic Meditation if you so desire.

You’ll leave feeling energized, lighter, and possibly ready to learn this practice of OM!

$10, payable at the door.

Please arrive by 7:20--we will begin promptly at 7:30!

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or print this parking permit an you can park in any resident permit space:  turnonboston.com/parking/[masked]-08.pdf       

There are also plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave only one block away (and free after 6pm). We are a 10-minute walk from the Red Line at Davis Square. 

 http://tedxtalks.ted.com/video/TEDxSF-Nicole-Daedone-Orgasm--2

results.description:
It's March. Time for the NCAA Tournament to begin - one of our favorite times of the year.  Time for our monthly dads night out.  Time to make a BIG DEAL for March Madness!


By next Thursday night, your brackets will be completed. Time to put them to the ultimate test to determine if those challenging decisions, data analysis, or unscientific guesses you made were correct.  We'll gather at  Lincoln Tavern in South Boston (same as our 2014 party) to watch the NCAA Tourney together with a large crew of other dads.  Friday, March 18 is the first round of the hoops tourney and will deliver 16 games in one day...several of which are evening games.

If you saw their terrific highlight reel campaign during the NFL playoffs with Carson Palmer and Jordy Nelson, you probably know Dove Men+Care have been showcasing their #RealStrength campaign and now they're bringing it to March Madness with "Bonds of Real Strength." 

Dove Men+Care has generously agreed to sponsor "NCAA March Madness Viewing Party" Meetups in several of the City Dads Group locations on the same night.   So dads across the nation have the opportunity to meet up, bond together, watch college hoops, and create a lively discussion/banter on social media.  Special thanks to Dove Men+Care who will be covering the bill for the appetizers and drinks!

We strongly encourage dads to use social media during the NCAA Tournament and especially on the evening of our March Madness viewing parties by using the hashtag, #RealStrength and tagging handles @DoveMenCare @BostonDadsGroup 

* Based on space limitations, this meetup is only for Boston Dads Group members. No +1's, sorry.

* Appetizers and food/drink will be covered by our sponsor, Dove Men+Care

....and if you haven't already, please complete a bracket and compete in the national City Dads Group Bracket Pool.  Top three bracket scores win a Dove Men+Care gift pack and bragging rights!

To get into the bracket group and make your picks, click this link. Password: cdgbrackets: http://games.espn.go.com/tournament-challenge-bracket/2016/en/group?groupID=658220

Brackets must be completed by Thursday, March 17 by 11amEST. The password for the group is cdgbrackets

Scheduled Games for Friday Night:  TBD

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Again, we want to continue to have more hosted events like this in the future. Please take a moment to thank our sponsor via twitter: @DoveMenCare using #RealStrength hashtag.

Examples: "Thanks @DoveMenCare for sponsoring the @nycdadsgroup #citydads March Madness viewing party for our dads night out! #RealStrength"

OR "A bond of #RealStrength is meeting up with @nycdadsgroup for a much needed Dads Night Out to watch the NCAA Tourney. @DoveMenCare #CityDads"

results.description:
Fridays, March – mid-November | 8:30 – 10:00 pm
Offering Format: Public Event
Recommended for grades Pre-K – 12 and adults
Museum of Science
Free

Did you know that the Museum offers our starry-eyed public a free evening full of astronomy-themed fun on weather-cooperative Fridays?

Between 8:30pm and 10pm each Friday, weather-permitting, visit the Gilliland Observatory on the roof of the Museum’s parking garage. On clear nights, you can view stars, planets, the Moon, and other astronomical phenomena. On cloudy nights, tour the inside of our Observatory, and participate in astronomy-related activities run by our knowledgeable staff.

This program does not run on nights when the weather is inclement. For more details, and to find out if Astronomy After Hours is running on a given Friday, call our hotline,[masked]-0267. We update each Friday by 5:30pm with the evening’s plans.

Astronomy After Hours runs seasonally, from the first Friday in March to the last Friday before Thanksgiving. Admission is free thanks to the generosity of the Lowell Institute (parking charges still apply).

Thanks to Don Doughty for letting us know about the museum.

Source: http://www.mos.org/public-events/astronomy-after-hours

The unofficial kickoff of the 2016 multisport season at the events. This year it's at BU! http://tri-mania.com/boston/overview/

Click Here for More Information

Register today and if you are among the first 1,000 you will receive a goodie bag filled with product samples, valuable coupons and more. 

Team Competitions

EventHorizon will compete in the team challenge! Let me know if anyone is interested. We want to take 1st place on our home turf. So if you're a really good swimmer, cyclist or runner in the mile, reach out to me! 

Competitions in the Team Challenge:  - The Marathon Sports 4 x 1600m Relay (NEW for 2016!): This is a 4 x 1600m relay race that will take place on the super-fast INDOOR 200 meter track (complete with banked turns!) at Boston University's Track & Tennis Center which is located about 0.4 mile from BU's Fit Rec Center, the site of all other TRI-MANIA events and activities. Each member of the 4-person team will run 1600m on the track in traditional relay team fashion... Athlete 1 runs 1600m and then hands the baton to Athlete 2 who runs 1600m and so forth.  There will be two 10-team heats -- at 9:00am and 9:45am -- and teams select their heat when registering for the overall Team Challenge.  Your team must include at least 1 female. The fastest 2 teams in the Relay Run will be awarded prizes (to be announced).- 

FastSplits Indoor Bike Time Trial (TT): The TT has each member of a 4-person team hook their bike to a CompuTrainer and ride a 10k course. CompuTrainers simulate the feel of the road with varying degrees of road resistance just like the real thing! Each team member must complete the 10k and the combined time of all 4 members forms the TT Team Time. TT heats are offered throughout the day and you select your TT heat when registering. The TT takes place on the TRI-MANIA expo floor inside BU's Fit Rec Center. Your team must include at least 1 female. The fastest 2 teams in the TT will be awarded prizes (to be announced).- 

Relay Team Swim Challenge presented by WINNING SWIMMING: The Swim Challenge is a 800 yard relay swim event that requires each member of a 4-person team to swim 200m yards. The combined time of each member will be the Team Time. The Swim Challenge takes place in the world-class competition pool inside BU's Fit Rec Center. There will be two heat times (12:00pm and 12:30pm). Your team must include at least 1 female.   The fastest 2 teams in the Swim Challenge will be awarded prizes (to be announced).  

After wards we'll have a social meetup at the Sunset Cantina across the street from the BU Fitrec!

results.description:
LibrePlanet is an annual conference hosted by the Free Software Foundation.  Edward Snowden will keynote via free software video call, followed by two days of live events.

Please register on the LibrePlanet 2016 website.  RSVP'ing solely via Meetup will not be considered registration.


The LibrePlanet conference is for people who care about their digital freedoms, bringing together software developers, policy experts, activists, and computer users to learn skills, share accomplishments, and address challenges facing the free software movement. LibrePlanet 2016 will feature programming for a wide range of ages and experience levels.

Organized around the theme "Fork the System", the conference's sessions will examine how free software creates the opportunity of a new path for its users, allows developers to fight the restrictions of a system dominated by proprietary software by creating free replacements, and is the foundation of a philosophy of freedom, sharing, and change.

FSF members and students attend LibrePlanet at no cost! Become a member now.

Please register on the LibrePlanet 2016 website.  RSVP'ing solely via Meetup will not be considered registration.

More upcoming events:

results.description: Come check out dragon boating with Living Root! We're a co-ed dragon boat team and we're always looking for new paddlers to join us. This is a great way to get in shape, stay in shape, meet people, and do something fun and competitive. How to get there: We practice at the pool at the JFK Elementary School in Somerville. Walk through the outdoor basketball courts to the rear of the building to find the pool entrance. Take the stairs down to the ground floor and head through the locker rooms to get to the pool. Practice will begin poolside at 9 am. Wear athletic clothing. Although we won't do any swimming, you will get somewhat wet. Parking is free in the school parking lot. The T station at Porter Square is a 5 minute walk away. Practice will last an hour and 30 minutes. We provide paddles and all the necessary equipment--just bring yourself! No paddling experience is required. We have an excellent coaching staff who will teach you everything you will need to know. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice, and you're welcome to join us. Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked] [url=http://www.livingroot.org/]www.livingroot.org[/url]

results.description:
This tr. offers some of the best views in the Fells! Living up to its name it is very rocky and offers rewarding but rugged hiking!! Book says 4 mi. 3.5 hrs

This hike is rated hard/intermediate, This is a group event and participants are expected to follow the lead, stay together, stop at junctions or summits, and support all participants should circumstances require teamwork. We start together and finish together. If you decide to leave the group at any time, you are on your own. We hike in light rain or showers, but heavy snow or extreme cold weather cancels. Bring water, hiking boots (not sneakers), bug spray and lunch/snacks. Protect yourself against deer ticks and dress in layers.

No dogs and no guests are allowed on hikes. Have your guest join the group so they can agree to the liability waiver and attend an event.

Please remember that your Event Organizers are volunteers, the event is free and we are all adults. The people who have the best times on these hikes are those who stay loose and roll with things as they happen.

By clicking the "Yes" option on the RSVP link you are agreeing to the Liability Waiver as stated below:

Remember: Your Event Organizers are volunteers. You are solely responsible for your own safety and enjoyment. As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you have read and agree to adhere to the safety standards detailed @ http://www.hikesafe.com/; the organizer(s) of this activity is a volunteer; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
The Boston Spring Open 2016 is coming!

This is our continuation of last year’s very successful Boston Spring Open 2015. This time only better! We moved up the limit to 100 players, and booked the whole first floor of Microsoft NERD Center, overlooking the Charles River and Boston skyline. Check out our last year’s photo and results.

We welcome players of all levels, from professional to beginner. Depending on our strength distribution this year, it is likely to end up with 4 or more divisions (decided on the game day): open division, one or two divisions for dan players, one or two divisions for 1-5kyu players, and one division for 6-15kyu players. All beginners lower than 15kyu will be paired as 15kyu for handicap settings (challenge yourself!).

Except for the last division (6-15kyu), which is a handicap division based on AGA ranks, all other divisions will be even games. See “Format” section for details.

Cash prizes will be awarded in all divisions, with a top prize of at least $150.

• TsumeGo Challenge:

We will provide 50 TsumeGo problems around the hallway for players to solve during the break and lunch hours. Problems will be divided into 3 levels: DDK, SDK and Dan. The champions who solve most problems in each division will get a small gift prize. (Open division players are excluded from this activity)

• Logistics:

Preregistration required! There is a limit for this tournament of 100 players.

Preregistration closes on 2016, March 18 at 9am (24 hours before tournament start).

Please use Meetup to pay online: RSVP to this event and follow directions.

Fee: $20 (All proceeds will go towards prize money)

Please use Paypal to pay online: we are having trouble with Meetup payments at the moment, so please click [here] to pay. Once your payment has been processed we will mark you as "paid" in Meetup.


• AGA Membership Required! 

You must be a registered AGA member before the tournament begins! http://www.usgo.org/join-aga-today 

If you need to become a member, there are three options: 

1. Online regular membership ($30) 
2. Online one-day membership ($10) 
3. MGA promo new membership ($15) Contact Walther Chen or David Kahn for details. You may bring the form to the Sat meetups to sign. This option may take some time to process, so act now! 

Location: Microsoft NERD Center, 1 Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA. It's a beautiful space overlooking the Charles River!

Building entry: all participants are required to sign a waiver and present government issued ID at the front desk. For minors, a guardian with ID is required to accompany them.

Parking: On-site indoor garage parking weekend rate is $10/day. Entrance at One memorial drive.

Time:

Check-in time: 8:15 am - 8:45am

Tournament starts: 9am

Round 2 starts: 11am

Lunch break: 1-2pm

Round 3 starts: 2pm

Round 4 starts: 4pm

Awards and finalize: 6pm

Format:

• All Games are AGA rated 

• 4 rounds, Swiss McMahon pairing

• Time Settings: 30 minutes main time, 5 x 30s Japanese Byo-yomi Overtime

• All games will be even, except for the 6-15 kyu division, which will be handicapped according to rank.

• Each division is separated. Please commit to all 4 games and don't take "Bye"s.

results.name: Boston Spring Open 2016

results.description:
• [Don't be concerned if you don't see many RSVPs here... our members tend to RSVP via our members site at WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org.]

Please arrive at 9:00 am. From 9 to 9:15 am, we set up the meeting and network. We start the meeting at 9:15 am, and continue until 10:45 am. When you enter Church of the Good Shepherd, walk downstairs and take a left. If you arrive late, just walk in and have a seat at any open spot.

Please visit "Meeting Roles & Responsibilities" for more information about what to expect from a club meeting.

Here's a sample agenda for our meeting:

9:00 AM Setting up/Networking

9:15 AM President's Greeting and Club announcements

President opens meeting and welcomes guests

Toastmaster's Welcome

Introduces each role, its purpose, and the person who will perform the role.

Humorist/Invocation

Starts the meeting on a light-hearted note.

Grammarian's Word of the Day

Encourages each of us to add a new word to our vocabularies. Challenge us to use the new word spontaneously.

Scheduled Speeches

Club members give the speeches that they've scheduled and prepared in advance using the guidelines from one of the Toastmasters International communication manuals.

Table Topics

Our meeting's Topicsmaster provides our members and guests with an opportunity for demonstrating and honing their skills for impromptu speaking.

General Evaluator's Introduction

Introduces evaluation team members and evaluate the evaluators and the meeting in general.

Speech Evaluations

Club members provide helpful, supportive feedback to each of the scheduled speaker in a positive and friendly manner.

Grammarian's Report

Grammarian reports on how many times speakers used the Word of the Day and how we used the English language.

Ah-Counter's Report

Ah-counter reports how many filler-words and false starts were used by each participant, to raise speakers' awareness of these instances and to encourage improvement.

Timer's Report

Timer reports speaking times of all major speaking roles to encourage members learn to accomplish tasks within set time limits.

General Evaluator's Report

General evaluator provides a review of the meeting, what went well, and areas for improvement to encourage continual growth and an optimal quality of our meetings.

Toastmaster's Closing Remarks

10:45 AM President Adjourns Meeting

We usually have a convivial lunch at The Red Lentil. Hang around after the meeting for details.

WatertownSaturdayToastmasters.org

<a href="http://watertownsaturdaytoastmasters.org/"></a>

We'll have a hands-on Docker and Kubernetes code lab day. Codeship sr. developer Nick Gauthier and Google engineer Ray Tsang will lead this hands on day of learning about these two important technologies.

FULL NAME REGISTRATION REQUIRED: We need you to add your FULL NAME during registration to enable you to enter the Google building for this event. Registration closes at 3:00PM Thursday 3/17/16. 


Here's what to expect

9:30AM: Doors open Light breakfast will be served

10:00AM: Hands on introduction to Docker code lab lead by Nick Gauthier

12:00NOON: Use-Case - Docker @Ericsson by Igor Moochnick 

12:45 PM: Lunch 

1:30PM Hands on introduction to Kubernetes with Ray Tsang

4:30PM: Wrap up and socialize

Lab leads and speakers

Nick Gauthier is a web developer who started with Ruby on Rails but quickly adopted JavaScript, SQL, HTML5, and most recently, Go and Docker. He has a passion for testing software and open source projects. On the weekends, Nick is a competitive pc gamer and cat photographer. @ngauthier

Igor Moochnick has been building enterprise cross-platform and cross-technology distributed systems for more than 20 years. He is passionate about all the technologies and methodologies that can enable applications to scale seamlessly, to process large amounts of data, and to serve more customers.
A cloud architect, he works with teams to improve their development processes and effectiveness with Cloud-enabling technologies, Agile practices, DevOps processes and automation tool-chains. @igor_moochnick

Ray Tsang is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform.  Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences.  Follow Ray at @saturnism.

Do you like creating stuff on your computer and LOVE baseball? Come hack with us this Saturday, March 19, from 9:30-6 at General Assembly near South Station http://www.baseballhackday.com/boston/

2016 Baseball Hack Day is the fifth annual hacking event (also known as hackathon, hack fest or code fest) where area baseball minds come together, form a team, and collaborate to create baseball-related projects to compete in a friendly one-day competition. The goal of the day is to bring creative tech minds with passion for baseball into one room and see what they can produce within a limited time. The project could be (but is not limited to) a tool, simple web app, mobile app, web site, or data visualization. The event is also held in four other cities: Philadelphia, Montreal, Chicago and San Francisco!

Baseball Hack Day is a free event thanks to our generous sponsors. Registration is required and seating is limited. The event is based on the principal of the Hack Day Manifesto and it will always be free to attend, and we are run by volunteers, and we’ll never be for-profit (It's a labor of love).

More details at http://www.BaseballHackDay.com

results.description:
The Lesbians of Color Symposium Collective (LOCSC), Inc in collaboration with Harvard Law School (HLS) LAMBDA hosts  New England’s 4th Annual Lesbians of Color Symposium (LOCS)on Saturday, March 19, 2016 from 10:00AM – 3:00PM at Harvard Law School - Wasserstein Hall, located at 1585 Massachusetts Avenue in Cambridge, MA. 

The event welcomes lesbian, bisexual, transgender, and queer-identified (LBTQ) women of color and our  allies for a day of empowerment to celebrate and acknowledge the presence of women of color in the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) community.  A series of workshops focused on health/wellness, gender expression, activism, and other topics relevant to the attendees will be facilitated by regionally and nationally recognized advocates of equality. 

Kaila Adia Story, Ph.D., an Associate Professor in the Departments of Women's & Gender Studies and Pan-African Studies and the Audre Lorde Chair in Race, Class, Gender, and Sexuality Studies at the University of Louisville is the event’s keynote speaker. Her research examines the intersections of race and sexuality, with special attention to Black feminism, Black lesbians, and Black queer identity. Dr. Story has appeared on Huffington Post Live a number of times discussing issues that relate to race, sexuality, popular music, and gender.

The 2016 LOCS will feature guest speakers Be Steadwell , Tiona McClodden and ONYX Restorative Justice

Join us and other LBTQ women of color and our allies for a day of empowerment, culture, and solidarity!

PRE - REGISTRATION is $45.00

For more information and a complete list of workshops, please visit www.locscollective.org.

For questions or comments, contact [masked]  or <a>[masked]</a>.

Stay connected with  #2016LOCS #HERstory by following @locs_pride (Twitter), locs_collective (Instagram) and “LIKE” us on facebook www.facebook.com/locscollective

**LOCSC, Inc provides community and cultivates resources for lesbian, bisexual, transgender, queer (LBTQ) identified women of color and our allies. We do this through advocacy, education, programming and counseling. Additionally, LOCSC hosts an annual conference that celebrates and unites our diverse sisterhood.
results.name: 4th Annual Lesbians of Color Symposium (LOCS)

results.description:
Kurukulla Center is once again delighted to have Venerable Amy Miller Visit our Center for teachings this coming March. Venerable Amy will be arriving on Friday, March 18, and will depart on Friday, March 26. On Saturday March 19 she will be offering a class: Awakening Mindfulness: The Importance of Meditation and How to Practice Calm Abiding (Shiné)

As we do for all our visiting teachers, we will need your help and active participation to make offerings of service to Venerable Amy to ensure that she has a pleasant and comfortable stay.  If you are interested in volunteering, please contact Michelle and Jennifer at [masked].

Thank you!


About Venerable Amy:

Venerable Amy J. Miller (Ven. Lobsang Chodren) was ordained as a Buddhist nun in June 2000 by the great Tibetan master, Ven. Choden Rinpoche, and has been teaching extensively since 1992. She first encountered Tibetan Buddhism in the spring of 1987 during a course at Kopan Monastery in Nepal. Since then, she has spent a great deal of time engaged in meditation retreats, study, teaching, and Buddhist center management throughout the world.

Her teaching style emphasizes a practical approach to integrating Buddhist philosophy into everyday life. She is happy to help people connect with meditation and mindfulness in an effort to gain a refreshing perspective on normally stressful living. Venerable Amy's courses and retreats focus on establishing and maintaining a meditation and mindfulness practice, death and dying, overcoming anxiety and depression, battling addiction, dealing with self-esteem issues, and cultivating compassion and loving kindness. She is also often involved in leading a variety of retreats.

Venerable Amy is the co-author of <a>Buddhism in a Nutshell</a>- and a contributor to Living in the Path, a series of <a>on-line courses</a> produced by FPMT. Based in the United States, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Amy teaches and leads retreats and pilgrimages around the world. Her teaching schedule and other information can be found at <a>www.AmyMiller.com</a>.
results.name: Awakening Mindfulness: The Importance of Meditation

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

results.description:
The Infernal Slayers is a biweekly D&D 5e campaign set in the Forgotten Realms. This campaign is a wild high-fantasy romp with a great DM, friendly players, and some crazy characters.  The campaign is very open to unique, creative and unusual characters.  It usually meets in the Watertown/Waltham area, at players' homes every other week, currently on Saturdays.  This particular session will be in Cambridge because reasons.


The Infernal Slayers have an immediate opening for one (1) additional player. Character is your choice, but if you're a rogue we will give them extra loot.*  This is a great time to join this campaign, as it has just completed a story arc and is about to begin another. 

So, join us for adventure, excitement, all the things a Jedi does not crave! Please bring your own equipment. On-the-job training will be provided. Safety not guaranteed. Health plan is flexible and includes both HMO (healing magic organization) and PPO (paladin preferred organization) options. Or, if you like your current cleric, you can keep them!

Act fast, openings in this group never last because it is so well run!  Feel free to waitlist if you want to be kept apprised of future openings in this group or other groups I help out.  

The PC's in this campaign are currently level 6.

As this is an existing group that is focused on a long-term campaign, the DM and/or I will probably briefly interview new players to make sure we have a good fit.


*At least, if their INT is low, we will *tell* them we are giving them extra loot.


Disclaimer: I play in this campaign, but I am not the great DM alluded to above.

results.description:
What are things we can do that will make us truly happy?  

Viktor Frankl says "For success, like happiness, cannot be pursued; it must ensue, and it only does so as the unintended side effect of one's personal dedication to a cause greater than oneself or as the by-product of one's surrender to a person other than oneself."

I have a post-card that says: There is no way to happiness, happiness is the way - Buddha.  I'd love to know if that is a true attribution to Buddha.  

Jesus doesn't really talk much on happiness, though some have translated the beatitudes "blessed are the..., blessed are the..., blessed are the..." (Matthew 5) as "happy are the..." etc...

What do you think?  

Also - is this a good time?  I'd like to do something for the morning non-alcohol community, as there is always something social for the night/drinking types :).

Peace!

results.description:
One of the reasons I created this group is to learn how to eat more healthy. What has been working great for me, is eating clean.  To me that means, minimizing my consumption of processed foods. Here is a cooking demonstration focused on eating for your health.

"• Foods that heal. Taste your way to better health with Community Servings."

The seminar is scheduled to run: 11am-1:30 pm

This is a cooking demonstration to teach people how to use ingredients and cook to combat different health conditions, such as diabetes, cancer and autoimmune diseases. I thought it'd be interesting to check this out. After which, we can explore the Public Market, perhaps get a bite to eat and of course, go for a walk! The Boston Public Market is really something fun to experience! Just outside, Haymarket is a bustling place selling produce and I believe even meats. It should be on everyone's Boston "to do" list!

I've reserved ten spots. If you want to join, and there's no spots left here, go right to their webite. This is a free seminar and should be really interesting.

I tried to paste the website here, but had trouble, so I encourage you all to check it out on:

www.bostonpublicmarket.org

Go to the "kitchen" link and check out this Saturday's  calendar.

See you Saturday!

results.description:
(a set of 6 Saturday classes)


Always wanted to learn how they really fought in the middle ages? Forget any ideas about crude battering on armour; the successful warrior strikes to the gaps and the openings of his or her opponent's attacks, and supplements this with disarms, throws, and other techniques which secure the advantage over larger or stronger attackers.

Around the year 1400, Fiore dei Liberi trained medieval knights and squires, and authored multiple books of medieval combat, some of which have survived to the present day. His method, L'Arte d'Armizare (the Art of Bearing Arms), shows an integrated and cross-referenced system of sword, dagger, grappling, spear & lance, pollaxe and other weapons on foot and on horseback, with and without armour, and easily dispels any illusions that medieval combat was about unskilled strength.

Our beginners' course is six linked classes that give the basic techniques and vocabulary of L'Arte, and enables men and women to begin regular unarmoured training and learning.  No prior training needed; all class equipment is provided.

So, come join the scholars and combatants of our company!

(The price shown is for the set of all six classes (Mar 5, 12, 19, Apr 2, 9 and 16.  There is no class on the weekend of Mar 26) and membership and registration.  Classes are not offered separately.  We'll send an email with some class materials before the first session.)

results.description:
Top rope climbing at central rock gym in Watertown. We will meet at the large cubby area near the entrance.
All levels of skill welcome. They have climbing routes for everyone. If your new to CRG but know how to belay please arrive early to take the certification test which takes about 5 min. If you would like to learn to belay CRG offers a class at 12:00pm. Belay knowledge is not necessary. We will pair you up with a group of three that do know how.
Day pass can be purchased with gear rental, or alternatively if this is something you'd enjoy and would like to try more than once consider the current groupon for a 1 month membership at a discount price that also includes gear rental. Climb twice and it will pay for itself. http://www.groupon.com/deals/central-rock-gym-watertown-1?utm_campaign=UserReferral_mih&utm_source=uu56660797

Post-climb plans: It is a tradition for myself a few fellow climbers to get Pho afterwards in Waltham at a place called Pho and Spice. Hope you can join us.

results.description:
http://www.mfa.org/programs/special-event/nowruz-2016-the-persian-new-year-festival


Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

Let's again ring in the Persian New Year, Nowruz, and welcome the first day of spring at the MFA! (Check out the pictures from last year's Meetup event)


Learn about Nowruz traditions and explore Persian works of art. Enjoy demonstrations, music, dance, art and more throughout the day.


All events are free with Museum admission. The cost of general admission is $25 ($23 for seniors).  However, you may be able to get a discounted ticket at your local library.

Also, many employers may have discounted or even free tickets for their employees. You may want to check your human resources department if such discounted/free tickets exist for you.

Or consider getting a MFA membership and you have unlimited admission to the museum and skip the long lines. 

The plan is to meet at 11 am in lounge/couch area of the Sharf Visitor Center on the first floor.  

Since this event will be a somewhat crowded and roaming , it will be very difficult for latecomers to connect with the group. If you are late, I can not guarantee that you will recognize me or fellow members or we  to be able  recognize you from the crowds.  Once the event starts, I put away my smartphone and concentrate on enjoying the event with fellow group members.  Please plan ahead and allow a little extra travel time to this event.

If you need to familiarize yourself to this location, here is a link to the floor plan: http://mfas3.s3.amazonaws.com/MFA_Map_Sep2015_Level1.pdf

I strongly recommend that you  take public transportation, the Green E line stops right in front of the museum. Also there are several buses that also stop in front of the museum. Check out these links for more information on getting to the museum: http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here, www.mbta.com .

Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.

I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana
results.how_to_find_us: 11am at the Sharf Visitor Center couch / lounge area

results.description:
Do you have intuitive gifts?
Do you desire to help others and know yourself through service?
Do you want to make this world a more joyful place?

For thousands of years, the spiritual lineage now known as the Modern Mystery School has been training individuals to realize, actualize, and fulfill their unique life purpose. Since 1997 it has been open to the public as a "University for the Soul", and offers a lifetime of advanced training which empowers and serves as a reminder to those seekers of truth who know that all questions and answers are within them. This is training that untrains you, learning where you unlearn, and healing where you let go of what has always blocked you from being YOU. If you seek a path which can help you:
* heal yourself deeply and profoundly
* wield more spiritual light and authority in your own life
* work in union with the angelic forces of light
* stop taking on negativity from others
* overcome your own negative ego
* serve other human beings in their unique progression

Then join us for a half day free workshop! In this presentation, we will:
* discuss what healing truly is
* experience the energies of a sacred geometry temple
* meditate
* demonstrate a sacred healing technique passed down for thousands of years in an unbroken lineage
* discuss the path of progression offered with the Modern Mystery School
* open the door for you to step forward into a higher version of yourself

This event is free of charge, however, the favor of an RSVP is requested. Serious registrations only -- space is limited. Please RSVP using our secure online registration system (copy paste this link into your browser if it does not work automatically):
https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/ws?studioid=141093&stype=-8&sTG=25&sVT=67&sView=day

We look forward to working with you!

With Love,
Jordan, Casey, Ari and Alex

results.description:
The first meet up in February was a success ! We had great participation and energy. We did some sharing of personal experiences of loved ones who passed, we meditated, and we practiced mediumship. I was enormously impressed with the skills of the participants. We can all tune into the spirit world !

During this meet up- we will share experiences and we will do a meditation before we start to practice mediumship.

We will be practicing psychometry. This involves touching/holding an object and tuning into the impressions/energy from the object. Each object holds a history- impressions left on it from the previous owner. We will practice tuning into the object to sense who it belonged to.

Please bring an object from a deceased loved one to this circle if you have one. No worries if you don't have an object to share! Please do not tell anyone who the object belongs to when you first arrive at the circle since we are going to use this to practice in class.

Looking forward to seeing all you Mediums In Training !

Cost is $ 15

A lot has changed since then and they would like to bring everyone back and give an update on where things are, what challenges they have run into up to this point and answer any questions anyone may have about the rehabbing process.

Come learn the ropes from two local pros and make sure to check out and like their Facebook page and follow them on Instagram (hrvhomes) to stay updated on all their projects.

Looking forward to seeing everyone there!
results.name: Somerville Condo Conversion Update

results.description:
Update- March 10

We may change our itinerary a bit. The Wayside opening date is not yet released.  It may not be open until May/June.  We will be visiting Orchard House and Sleepy Hollow.  Then either lunch on Concord or Lexington Center, then drive back to Somerville and Cambridge.


Wayside will be scheduled for our 2nd bookish trip.


Orchard House is a historic house museum in Concord, Massachusetts, USA. It was the longtime home of Amos Bronson Alcott and his family, including his daughter Louisa May Alcott who wrote and set her novel Little Women there.

Current Admission Rates


Adults:  $10.00
Seniors (62+ years) & College Students (w/ID):  $8.00
Youths (ages 6-17):  $5.00
Children under 6 & Members:  Free
Family Rate (2 Adults & up to 4 Youths):  $25.00

Or $5 if you reserve a pass from the library

I can pickup and drop off at Alewife Station at 10:30 AM. Otherwise, we can meet at Orchard House parking at 11AM.  

Sleepy Hollow Cemetery 


Beautiful planned cemetery with ridges and natural bowls framing a wide variety of stones and memorials. “Author’s Ridge” is home of the graves of Henry David Thoreau, Nathaniel Hawthorne, Louisa May Alcott, and Ralph Waldo Emerson, among other notables. Also visit the Civil War memorial sculpted by Daniel Chester French. Open year round, daylight hours. Free.

After the tour, we can lunch at Concord center or Lexington center. 

And if anyone is interested, we have one more TOUR! 

Bring your best camera.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be waiting up front. If you cannot find us, text me at 781 325 8776.  I will reschedule if it snows.
results.name: Bookish Road Trip - Orchard House, Sleepy Hollow

Spend a part of the day or many hours celebrating the 331st birthday of Johann Sebastian Bach!

MEETUP - Open Rehearsal of Bach Cantata BWV 182


"Join us as The Orchestra and Chorus of Emmanuel Music prepares Bach Cantata BWV 182, Himmelskönig, sei willkommen, conducted by Artistic Director Ryan Turner."

Admission is free, but reservations are requested. 

RESERVE HERE.


The rehearsal starts at 11:30am. Before I will have reserved a pew or two (if someone wishes to arrive 11:00-11:15 to assist, that would be appreciated). We will meet from 11:15 to 11:25 inside the entrance.


OPTIONAL - Before the rehearsal and/or after, go on your own to BOSTON BACH BIRTHDAY 331 (starts at 8am), located a short distance away at the corner of Berkley and Marlborough Streets. "Birthday 331" is sponsored jointly by the First Lutheran Church of Boston and the Boston Chapter, American Guild of Organists, "Celebrating the 331st Birthday of Johann Sebastian Bach (March 21, 1685) and Looking Towards the 500th Anniversary of the Reformation: 1517-2017."
More info

Members who attend the rehearsal and wish to then go on to Bach Birthday 331 will gather inside the Emmanuel entrance to walk 3 or so blocks to First Lutheran Church of Boston.

We're doing a fun 10-week training program! All levels are welcome, and you don't need to be able to make it every week. In week 1, we timed ourselves in a few key events (e.g. 100 freestyle), and now we're doing a training program to get ourselves faster. At the end of 10 weeks we'll time ourselves again and see how much we've improved! If you can't make a week, don't worry, you can still come to the other weeks.


The 10 weeks will include clinics on technique, flip turns, and any special requests, as well as some good sets to get us swimming faster. If there's a race you're targeting and want to work on that distance or event, let us know and we can help tailor the workouts for you.

We go across the street for pizza (or other food if you don't eat pizza) every week after the swim. Save time to join us! We usually finish up by about 4:30pm.


---------------


The pool opens at 2pm, so we meet to go in at 1:45 so that we can be out on the pool deck by 2. $6 to get in, Cambridge residents $5 (or you can buy a 10-pack for an approximate 10% discount, and we do these weekly so you'll have the opportunity to use them up).

Street parking is available but stressful, and the 69 bus drops off down the block, or you can bike or run there and do 2/3 of a triathlon :)

results.description:
{Do you seek greater inner peace?  Peacemakers is a group that helps you look at what "peace" means to you and helps you find how to create more peace in your life.} 

Our Topic This Evening Will ....

... provide you an opportunity to let go of tension, upset, and judgements so that you can experience greater peace.

Many of us have accepted living with tensions in our bodies, with upsets spoiling our mood at unexpected times, with judgments sneaking in. 

Come join us as we practice living our lives more peacefully. 

Peace is not being passive, submissive or indifferent. Peace is an active consciousness that we can learn to enter into, enriching our individual lives, our social situations and the world at large. 

During this evening, we will practice discovering the peace that is always present within us -- no matter what else is going on inside us or outside us in the world.   As we practice recognizing our inner core of peace, we become increasingly able to choose to live in that consciousness of inner peace, even at difficult times of our lives. 

We will look at where we unconsciously practice "against-ness", and learn to let go of that feeling of against-ness, to better work with reality and with the people who surround us. As we let go of "against-ness", we also let go of the upset feelings, prejudices, judgments, tenseness, etc. 

This meeting is sponsored by the Institute of Individual and World Peace (www.iiwp.org)

To Prepare ....

1) When do you feel "against-ness"? 


2) What are the physical signs of your against-ness? (e.g., tightness in throat)  

3) What emotional signs or mental beliefs could be signs of against-ness?

4) How could you be more effective if you were in peace even when bad things happened?

Our Leaders This Evening

David Jenkins aspires to live his life more and more in peace. He considers himself a student of living the four principles of peace in his life. This is his highest priority. He is overjoyed to have been involved with the Peacemaker Project for several years. It expands peace in a quiet, loving way, one person at a time.

Emily Page delights in finding joy with others and as an inner process one moment at a time.She's been assisting with Boston Area PeaceMaker Meetings because the simple tools shared go so deep, work so fast and foster such harmony between participants, one session after another. 

Philosophy: The philosophy grounding this work is the realization that peace must start with the individual. One can not fight for peace. If we are going to be a conduit for peace, we must start with ourselves and be in peace. Peace is defined as the absence of againstness. If we can be in peace without being against ourselves or others or situations and encourage others to do the same, then we can be a conduit for peace. 

Facilitators Motivation: We aspire to live our lives more and more in peace. This intention is our highest priority. Participating in these meetings is one way to learn to live our lives more and more in peace. Encouraging others to do the same is strengthening for us all.
results.name: Peacemakers: Create Inner Peace for a Happier Life

results.description:

Free

results.description:
"Street photography is almost a spiritual process for many because it is so personal and so akin to a kind of photographic enlightenment.  I see things: moments just reveal themselves because I have put my self in the right situation for it to happen." Nick Turpin.


Photo by Paul Rusell 

This Saturday we will focus our attention on the art of street photography. There are many definitions trying to pin down what exactly street photography is. It may or may not have people in it, may or may not be candid, may or may not be in public place... on and on. 

But what does seem to be true is that it shows some evidence of presence of people in an urban setting and it touches our soul. It makes us laugh, cry, or feel amused at how a glimpse of a moment of ordinary life can touch our hearts. Street photography offers us the opportunity to create meaningful images that tell a story. Are you ready to get started? Join us on Saturday.

Photo By Instructor Suzanne Merritt 

 To see it is very much about the moment. Being present, curious and creative are key skills we will work on.  Timing is everything when it come to street photography and chance favors the prepared photographer. This workshop will help you understand where to stand, how to anticipate the action and what camera settings work best for catching the action. But mostly it will help you see creatively and notice what others miss.

Photo By Suzanne Merritt Manila 2015

"Let’s focus on making memorable photographs. Photographs that stir us emotionally, that make us think about humanity, society around us, the people we interact on a daily basis, the small beauties of life that we pass up for granted, others who are suffering, and the hopes and dreams of everyday individuals." Eric Kim

Street PhotographyPhotographing people, strangers, friends, family, is a skill we should all strive to develop. It is a wonderful part of being a photographer, to be able to capture moment of beauty as people enjoy the simple pleasures of life.


Photo by David Gibson.  Good example of juxtaposition of subject and interesting background.

Some of the topics I will cover in the workshop will be:

• Timing and positioning so you increase the chances of getting the lucky shot.

• Composition of subjects within the frame and in relationship to each other.

• How to use elements of color, light, texture, and motion to evoke emotion and tell a story. 

• How to simplify the shot so you capture the essence of the moment.

• Some basic camera operation tips will be offered if you need them to freeze the action and catch the moment.

How to get permission for the photo with out destroying the candid feeling. 

Photo by Suzanne Merritt London 2015 Shopping for Shoes

This special workshop on street photography will introduce you to a step by step method for gaining confidence in photographing people. This is a essential skill for travel photographers, family photographers, and anyone interested in capturing the ordinary moments of life in a way that tells a story.

Catching the Moment Photo by Suzanne Merritt Manila 2015

We will start at Harvard Square where there are plenty of people to practice on.  People will be busy shopping, eating, and watching street performers so they will never notice you are photographing them for your class assignments.

How the workshop is structured:

We will meet together at the Harvard Square Au Bon Pain where I will give a short introduction to the topic of street photography and show you sample photos. 

Photo by Suzanne Merritt Fogg Museum Harvard Square 2016 Fresh perspective.

You will be given specific photo assignments designed to build your skills step by step. I will provide handout cards so you can practice the assignments again after the class.

At the end class there will be social time where we will take a look at the photos of the day and give each other constructive critique. I highly recommend you plan on joining us for this part of the workshop. We also critique our work after class on our group site so you can post 5 photos from class and get feedback. This is a highly valued aspect of our group. 

Wonderful eye contact and interaction with the subject. Student Heather C.

Please RSVP right away to hold your spot in this class. The tuition for the workshop is $45.00 I look forward to seeing you on Saturday. 

P.S. This class is appropriate for all levels so if you have just joined the group, this would be a perfect place to start. You can leave your camera on Auto if the is where you are at the moment. 

You do need a camera rather than an iPhone for this one but not a tripod. You will meet like minded people who love photography and you will learn some new skills at the same time. What a great way to spend the afternoon!

Suzanne
results.how_to_find_us: Details provided once I have the full class list.
results.name: Fun Creative Seeing Street Photography: What it is and how to do it.

Munay-Ki Rites of Initiation
Gifting Group Saturdays, March 19, March 26 and April 9.  2-4 pm
Suggested donation: $20 per session. Space is limited to ten
RSVP to this Meetup and CALL Judy[masked] to join the wait list.
Note: end time is approximate

</a>

<a href="http://ahigherbalance.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/Munay.Ki_.Web_.jpg">

</a>

<a href="http://ahigherbalance.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/04/Munay.Ki_.Web_.jpg">

Receive the Ancient Sacred Rites of Healing and Initiation.  Coming from the high Andes in Peru, these ancient rites meaning "love" and "power" help us to step into our truth and the fullness of who we are. They have been gifted to us in the West to help us heal and come back into right relationship with ourselves, each other and the Earth. These rites of healing and initiation have been passed down for thousands of years from the Incan elders and from those that came before them. For more info about the rites: Munay-Ki.org. Your commitment to attend all sessions is requested. Pre-registration required--class is limited. Please Rsvp and also contact Judy at[masked]-1236. Receiving these Rites is a sacred act; you receive a one-on-one initiation for each Rite; followed by a fire ceremony. This program is gifted by Judy Copp, a  Munay-Ki graduate who has been trained to offer the Rites.

THE RITES Rite One: Healers Rite; so everyone you touch is blessed
Rite Two: Bands of Power and Protection: walk this earth in fullness of your personal power
Rite Three: Harmony Rite: receive the 7 Archetypes into the chakras, including three archanges
Rite Four: Seer’s Rite:  awakens your inner seer
Rite Five: Daykeeper’s Rite: Step beyond fear and practice peace
Rite Six: Wisdomkeeper’s Rite: Step outside of time and taste infinity
Rite Seven: Earthkeeper’s Rite: connects you to the stars and sun
Rite Eight: Starkeeper’s Rite: Your body becomes luminous
Rite Nine: Creator Rite: Be in stewardship for all creation
Rite Thirteen: The Rite of the Womb: Release the womb from fear and pain; heal the womb of earth.

Please note: this program is limited to 8 people. If you rsvp and your plans change, please change your rsvp so others on a wait list may join the group. Thank you so much for understanding.

results.description:
This year, we will be welcoming in the Spring with a Labyrinth Walk.  We invite you to arrive between 2:30 pm and 3:00 pm, during which time you can register, talk with your sisters, and enjoy exploring the giveaway items in the nursery room.  Doors will open for our Labyrinth Walk and Ceremony at 3:00 pm. 

After entering the ritual space in silence, please find a seat and allow yourself to go deep within your own heart.  Before walking the labyrinth, you will receive guidelines and suggestions. During the walk, each woman’s silence is requested so that all may have their own inner journey. Please take care of your own needs. Water and a light snack will be provided during the walk. 


What to bring: -Clean socks for walking the labyrinth 
-Journal and pen to write 
-Special crystal to carry with you into the labyrinth 
-Bells to call in the spring
-Shawl or scarf if you wish 
-Special items for giveaway blanket -Check or cash for donation to Polaris (see below)
-$15 requested donation (lower income pay what you can). If you have pledged for the year, this circle is included.

Be sure to eat beforehand.
No scents please, for the sake of women with chemical sensitivities.

RSVPIf you are coming to this circle, please RSVP by Wednesday, March 16 to [masked] 

Half-the-Sky InitiativeAs part of our Half-the-Sky Initiativethis year, we will collect donations at this circle to go to the Polaris Project, an organization devoted to combating human trafficking, including sex trafficking. Among their ongoing projects are initiatives on sex trafficking of children, through illicit massage businesses, in hotels, and from Mexico. In addition, they operate the National Human Trafficking Resource Center Hotline ( https://traffickingresourcecenter.org/).

According to their website (https://polarisproject.org/ ),

Polaris is a leader in the global fight to eradicate modern slavery. Named after the North Star that guided slaves to freedom in the U.S., Polaris systemically disrupts the human trafficking networks that rob human beings of their lives and their freedom. Our comprehensive model puts victims at the center of what we do – helping survivors restore their freedom, preventing more victims, and leveraging data and technology to pursue traffickers wherever they operate. In addition, you have the opportunity to see Body & Sold, Deborah Fortson's award-winning documentary play, based on real-life interviews with teen victims of sex trafficking. We strongly encourage you to attend this important event, intended to raise awareness and open community discussion about sex trafficking in America. The performance is on Friday, March 18, 8:00 pm at the BU School of Theatre, 855 Commonwealth Ave., Boston. For more information: http://www.bu.edu/cfa/news-events/events/?eid=181351.

This afternoon program is an introduction to Diamond Way Buddhist practices and will be followed up a guided meditation.


Diamond Way Buddhism offers practical and effective methods to realize mind’s inherent richness for the benefit of all. With an accessible and modern style, it works with people’s confidence and desire, using every situation in life to develop fearlessness and joy.

John Christopherson is from Madison, WI and is a student of Lama Ole Nydhal. In addition to his day job as an elementary school teacher, he has been teaching Diamond Way Buddhism since 2006 around the world.

This lecture is part of a weekend program - to see the full schedule click here:

results.description:
We traditionally have a large social meetup twice each month. This gives everyone an opportunity to come and make new friends, practice their Japanese or English, and spend time with a bunch of interesting people from around the Boston area and overseas.  This meetup may be cancelled if there are very few RSVPs.

Close to Boylston on the Green Line, or Chinatown on the Orange Line.
Also a short walk from Park Street or Downtown Crossing. 

• From Boylston Station, go south on Tremont Street (away from Boston Common),  then take a right onto Stuart Street.  The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

• From Chinatown Station, go west on Boylston Street (toward Boston Common), then take a left onto Tremont Street. Turn right onto Stuart Street. The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

There is a map of the area below. If you have trouble finding us, please feel free to call or text me at[masked]-2923.  Also you can call or text if you come after we have left for Chinatown, although then there is a greater chance I will miss the call.

Come on by, relax, practice in either language of your choice, and enjoy being part of our growing community!

The Meetup does not end at 6 - instead, some time around there, we usually go out to Chinatown for dinner afterwards to eat family style - anyone who wants to come is welcome. The cost is usually around $12-20/person (not including any drinks for which people pay their own way).  We are open to restaurant suggestions.  However, I am not willing to get into dividing up large numbers of orders on one giant check, which is why we generally go to Chinatown and split everything down the middle.  If you don't want to eat at all, you can come and just enjoy the company for free.  

Please BRING CASH if you can and want to go to dinner - many of the restaurants limit cards to two per table, so if a lot of people have no cash it can be a problem.

Stuart Street view

In this FREE mini-workshop, you'll learn specific tools that you can use right away to master intimate connections that are meaningful and loving. Spend time with a group of like-minded friends (old and new) exploring what it means to live a life filled with love! If this feels scary to you and you've been holding yourself back, this workshop is for you! Discover what's in your way of having the most satisfying relationships including effective communication, and great sex. This workshop will focus on our innate ability to open to a greater love inside ourselves - that can be shared with others: a skill that when learned and practiced, enhances all of our relationships. Feeling deeply connected to yourself and your heart provides a deep sense of peace. You’ll learn specific tools that will:
• Enhance your ability to identify core wants, needs and desires
• Cultivate communication for healthy relating
• Become more intimate with yourself and others - with ease!
• Stay in a place of love when it’s most difficult

In this free mini-workshop, you’ll have the opportunity to connect with others through a variety of exercises designed to open your heart and support you in sharing authentically with one another.

Come and get a taste of what you’ve been craving in a totally safe, warm, loving and non-sexual environment. Learn more about what the Human Awareness Institute has to offer.
_____________________________
This event begins promptly at the scheduled time. There will be no admittance after the scheduled start time so as not to break the continuity of the workshop. We look forward to seeing you there! Blessings,
Don, Lydia & Ren
